sequence: This version of `` The Lost Horizon '' is actually not a bad film at all . I think the director does a great job in giving his story a dramatic tone, as all the characters have very strong personalities . The cinematography and the editing were also very good , and the special effects , especially the CGI , were well-done . But the one thing that didn't do it justice is that the story is pretty simple, which means the film has a short length to get to its climax . That's a pity , because the film is well-made , and it makes you think and remember things you never knew.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers. Ultimately the market place determines the message that is sent to the public. This movie dramatizes that point. A conservative white-collar advertising company is taken over by a group of street-wise African Americans chaired by a no-nonsense black man who wants to make a buck and believes he can sell products by telling the the truth. But the movie shows that no matter how hard he tries to do something different, the market place and the political system demands that he conform, rendering him no different than his predecessors.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not : intelligence and good messages . Accepted , in most cases , the way a man or a lady should treat a woman or man in every situation and at every level, this movie will show you the beauty and the grace in every aspect of relationships . And the message is good, the message is very important, because it is one of the things a woman or a man can be proud to be a woman or man in this world and in this generation . This is a movie for those of you who are still a kid .

Barbora Bobulova 's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time . It is so well written , I have cried reading it . If I had to pick one thing to improve in my writing skills , I would say to be more specific in my vocabulary , I often find that I am trying to say things when they do not even apply to me .This is especially true for my descriptions , which I often describe people who are not even as close as they think , they might as well be a fly on the wall .

I can not say this movie was a hilarious, but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. I like this darker kind of comedy; "very bad things", "8 heads in a duffel bag" or "coldblooded"The way the main character tries to get away with murder is a lot of fun to watch. To me it was not much of a surprise what the ending would be, but the way that ending came about was. Another thing that sticks out, is the way they have managed to involve the audience.

Separate LIES changed my life. Actually, the Q&A did.SPOILERS BELOW. Read only if you watch trailers or if you've already seen it:The Emily Watson character cheats on the Tom Wilkonson character. My first reaction to the puppy-dog-eyed Emily was "It's Over. Dump her. Bad riddance." For some reason, he stuck around. Not in a pathetic way. He just listened. And tried to accept her needs. At times he needed to leave. But he stuck by her and let her live her life.

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper, but no one he interviewed noticed that he was just pretending. Sasha Cohen is actually very intelligent guy, who pretends to be stupid, so he could get really honest answers from people... And it is very funny. So I didn't expect movie to be good, cause it was all acted - no real people or interviews. So the basic point of all show was lost. But I was wrong - I laughed all the time, it was one of the funniest films I ever saw.

This is a brilliant film . The story starts off in Romania , where Billy Crystal stars as an agent trying to rescue a couple of teenagers who have run away from foster care . The plot quickly takes us back to the USA where this film took place , where it was shot . While the story deals with teenagers , the story is very good and very believable . The acting is very good . It was a wonderful experience to watch this film . The story of these kids is very sad . A lot of tears are shed along with laughter .

Containing Billy 's famous humor , this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure , pleasantly surprising, and very well-written. And it's even a bit more fun than you might have expected. I've read a fair amount on this film and on Billy , but I have not read anything on this one . It seems like it's going to have a difficult time getting wide release , unless it gets picked up by HBO and becomes a TV series . I would recommend seeing it on HBO . This is not your typical comedy , and I don't say that lightly.

As many of today 's movies are guilty of , the plot is n't exactly stellar , the movie does its job quite well. But as you watch, you can't help but ask yourself , are they doing it for the fun ? Is it meant to be ? Are they just fooling people into being surprised ? I think they are. But then again, maybe it's their intention, maybe we're fooled by them and not the film , and that makes me very happy , so let's see if they can pull off a feat as impressive as that.

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people wouldn't like it. My wife has never seen it, and when I just rewatched it last night, I waited until after she went to bed. She might have been amused by a couple small snippets, but I know she would have had enough within ten minutes.Head has nothing like a conventional story. The film is firmly mired in the psychedelic era. It could be seen as filmic surrealism in a nutshell, or as something of a postmodern acid trip through film genres.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10 , and it just blew my mind. I’d watch it as a child, then the next summer as a teenager and the next as a young adult. The fact that it exists today is a testament to its lasting impact on me, and to the quality of the show that made it possible. While I have no particular memory of watching it at any point in my life before college, I do remember seeing the series on PBS in New York on the night of its original air date.

This is a well directed Columbo episode, with also some good character but the story just doesn't really know to interest enough and doesn't appear as well layered and constructed as was often the case with a Columbo movie. This also goes for the killer's plot to kill his uncle. It's quite simple and doesn't seem as well thought out. Perhaps this movie didn't really took itself serious enough, since the atmosphere of the movie is mostly light. At least when compared to different Columbo movies.For instance the movie features quite a large amount of comical relief, mostly coming from the Columbo character himself.

Like some people here, I love/loved Stingers! In Norway it got aired a lot later. That also means that we are in the 176th episode. (yea, that's right) I have to say that I really love Stingers! It can make me cry, laugh, smile and so on. I think I'm going to die the day we reach episode number 192. Stingers might be the on series(except from Grey's Anatomy) that I really watch! The actors are amazing! Especially Jacinta Stapleton! Personallly I think she is one of the best access we have!

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere , strikes him on the back and smashes his face to a pulp. There is blood everywhere but he just sits there in his own bloody mess. His wife tries to revive him with some water, but he's beyond her, so she lets him go with a promise she'll be home to help in time. That night, the husband has a dream where he is at home and sees his wife in her coffin.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an "against the system" type of movie and attitude. It is an excellent portrayal of the "system" in question and how ridiculous it truly is. The funny parts in the movie are in fact funny because they speak the truth about the world around us. Anyone who finds this movie to be unrealistic is simply denying the self evident truths about life. And that is to learn what you enjoy. That is what college should be about..I come to find that a comment must have at least 10 lines.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I 'm Dancing.' If you like the Irish film it would be a great film to see, but if you are a true Irish Catholic it's a great film to watch. This movie has got it all! It starts with the introduction of three people: the girl, a guy and their dog. They all meet for the first time and all three of them dance. All three people sing together and they get along with the other people in the theatre.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic lines and that the American Dream, as envisioned by George W. Bush and the rest of his ilk, is more than the sum of its parts. That is, it includes the ability and willingness of some to pursue their own individual dreams, but that they can do so is not only possible for those of us in the private sector, but it can also be accomplished by those in public, government and business. This isn’t the first time we have seen this movie in a more recent format.

This is what movies should aspire to . Funny without being totally stupid , a little sexy without having every woman at the bar thinking they are hot , romantic without having them all falling over for each other, and a little sad without all the romance. If there is a movie that can be described as both , I am not saying they are exactly the same , however , they could both be good . I have always loved a good dramatic , romantic , emotional movie that is set in a location , but it doesn't have to be in a city , town , island , etc.

I 've got to say it . Gary Busey saved this film . If it were not for his fine directing and acting skills, there'd have been a great chance for this flick to go over in the Oscar nominations . But that's not the case at all . A classic film with great special effects , outstanding acting skills , and excellent music . Busey is not only a great director but a good actor . His performance was perfect . This is one of the greatest and most popular movies ever made . It will live long in the memory , and will stay as a classic .

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety, my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of artistic expression often do not gain mass appeal. The story line depicts a young boy stealing a car and embarking on a surreal, dream-like adventure with very little basis in our conceptualization of time and space. Therefore, anyone who attempts to view this film from the perspective of its conformity to reality will likely be disappointed; it is not intended to be "realistic." It is, however, intended to be metaphoric with extensive symbolism apparent to those with superb attention to detail.

WTF ! ! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending ? ? The Notebook was good ... I am sure that it would have been very good. "What we can't be sure about, what we don't know for certain, is exactly how this thing works, and what the implications might be." "It's an interesting idea, I like it. We should get back to the drawing board." "We don't know." "What do you mean we don't?"

I was 19 or 20, years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City, Utah and I still remember the new dome theater, called the century 21. Layback chairs that rocked and a new sound system, large screen and huge open space between the screen and the packed theater. We felt all the excitement of a new preview screening of a film. Ta da da daa da ta da dada dada... I can still hear the opening music ringing trumpet and the crash of cymbals. I loved the interplay of characters and the filmed vistas.

What a shame this movie was never released . ( It is now playing on cable . ) I tuned this movie out, because I really don't care to see this movie any more, and it's not worth paying a penny for. It's a movie of a bunch of people that can't even get together to watch a film they want to see. This movie was so bad, it's ridiculous. I'm sorry but this movie is still one of the best things I have seen in a while.

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

If you haven't seen this film, do it. Its a genremix as i've never seen another. Some very surreal scenes, some hilarious funny stuff, a film noir felling, musical numbers with a swing, sex scenes (The 2nd best played orgasm on Film, bested only by Sally), a pitch of Orson Welles blended together into a work of art. As an work of art it hasn't to be logical at the end, at least not logical for everybody ;-). I owned an tv copy on VHS but loaned it to an ex-girlfriend and now i can't get it back.

`` I am ... proud of 'Head ' , '' Mike Nesmith has said . He should be , because it seems he will get his first All-Star Game MVP honor this year . "I'm looking forward to being back on the floor with our team," said Nesmith, who averaged 16 points and 10 rebounds for his hometown Atlanta Hawks . "It's an amazing group of guys to have here in Atlanta, and it's a really special moment for me because I grew up playing for them, and I'm back to play against 'em."

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then do n't watch this movie! This movie is just for kids and not for mature audiences. This movie was made to entertain and it does! It is a kids movie and you have to be a kid and not a parent to understand the storyline of this movie to enjoy it with your kids! Watch the trailer of this movie here: http://www.mymovie.com/trailer.html

What is this movie?!?!? This is not an adult movie!

This is probably my favourite TV show ever. I love all the characters, especially Alex, who is the PERFECT woman! Always makes me laugh and feel good when I watch this show. There is just something about it that is amazing, hard to describe.It seems some or all of the episodes synchronise with music albums as well. Here are a few examples. (The episodes start again when they end - but DON'T play end credits until the very end, but always play the opening credits. With most the episodes the album plays once and the episodes play twice, but some go on further.

I love this movie , though I do n't like how they picture Egyptians , being an Egyptian citizen myself I do n't see a difference with that , maybe a little bit . I think it's great , though I was not a fan of any of the other Egyptian films I saw , so this one is definitely worth a watch . It's no secret I'm not a big fan of most Egyptian films but I always enjoy Egyptian Cinema . There are a few films that I watch regularly that are very Egyptian and that is what I enjoy the most , I hope I never forget this one .

I thought this movie was pretty good!OK, so maybe it had a few scenes that could make people think of other horror movies, but i have seen a lot more pathetic movies that got much higher ratings than this! Many movies nowadays are remade to a more modern version and there's nothing wrong with that, it keeps the story alive. i don't think this movie was pathetic at all and i'm not just saying that because i'm a major Chad Michael Murray fan, but because i enjoyed it.

This movie is beautiful in all ways. It is visually stunning, and this is a good thing since the dialogue would only take up a page or two of paper. The acting is superb; it is subtle, passionate and intense. Ben Daniels does a fabulous job of turning himself into an animal, and mixing that wild nature with a man's overbearing passion and honor. There is not one flaw, not one mistake or wrong moment to be found anywhere. It is completely perfect, but only if you understand what you're going to experience.

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time, and this film speaks volumes about how little everyone really knew. His son's desire to find out who, and more importantly what he was is moving, and emotional.This film captures the spirit of what architecture is really about, what good design is, and the emotional price that is paid for it. Equally haunting is the sound track. If you see the film, and then listen to the sound track you can revisit the film simply by listening.

Let's be fair: there are no RULES for scriptwriting, so I won't say the movie SHOULD be something other than it is. I'll just state my opinion. OK, I really liked the script, the way things are told and characters are introduced. However, I think when a play is adapted to the silver screen, it could maybe try and fit this other media. Since this movie was directed by João Falcão, the same man who directed the play, it's not too much of a surprise that the film turned out a bit too theatrical.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters. I had never heard of it when it appeared on cable. After the first shock of realizing this is not like any other movie you have seen since Bringing Up Baby you have to let it sweep you along and run with it. Not until it's over do you realize it covers issues that are not only subtle but significant. Alienation, denial, wish-fulfillment, for a start. Cathy Bates owns this movie, she's never been better.

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't that good , but they are decent enough to hold your attention . I would give this one a higher rating if I were to rate movies based on entertainment value , but since I'm rating movies based on how I like it, I'll give it a 10/10. The movie looks great , the characters and situations are well written , and the story and plot is quite well thought out . The only thing I found annoying about this movie is the ending .

The Aristocats is really quite charming, and is rated far too low on IMDb. The songs aren't as memorable as the ones in the Jungle Book, but they weren't bad at all. The animation is really lovely, the best sequence being the landscape of Paris in general. It looked beautiful. This is probably Disney's most relaxing animation I think, and as another reviewer quite rightly said, who doesn't love cats? Another great piece of animation was O' Malley looking into Duchess's eyes, as their romance was so believable while not obvious.

This is Christmas time! A nativity in terms of rebirth, or at least this is what can be hoped regarding the Italian cinema. It was something like 30-40 years that the Italian cinema didn't craft an art piece of this size. This is an absolute contemporary film that can be also regarded at the same level of quality as the Italian masterpieces of the past, needless to quote any name. And finally this is also a big production for Italian standards of the time. In this movie there is a rare balance of different elements, all of them understandable and enjoyable at different levels of fruition.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time . Quickly the movie grabbed me with it’s beautiful imagery, haunting cinematography and the fact that it wasn’t about a female hero or heroine , but that was ok with me. The rest of the film I had forgotten all about. From the opening scenes , the film is full of beautiful visuals. I just wanted to jump on the band wagon and start dancing. There are a lot of good performances in this film , especially for a horror movie. The acting is top notch.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy (Garlin) wandering around Chicago with an eye for every woman he sees. The laughs keep coming almost every minute. It's a somewhat dramatic and serious story about a man looking for love, but done with great comedic writing and acting. The supporting roles are also very well done and very funny and really make the movie rich.Rose Abdoo is hysterical in her receptionist role taking you right into the mood of the rest of the film. Sara Silverman is awesome with some of the great bits she does with Jeff.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS...Hmm.... Only that this was one of the best TV series ever assembled!! You have actors of all ages, The actors that are somewhat known and that time forgot. Everyone playing their part to exact perfection! These shows always have some type of moral story to them which most of the time (if not all the time) is very true! You can feel that the man whose voice is dubbed over the credits and in the beginning and ending believes what he is saying wholeheartedly!

I just saw this film and I recommend it. It has a very good plot, it holds your complete attention, the acting is superb, Tom Wilkinson was fantastic and Emily Watson was also very good. A very good film indeed, about great and unconditional love. Tom Wilkinson's character is a man who is not prepared for the ordeal that is about to begin, but he takes the matter in hand as the story progresses, and this great actor gives a performance that makes you feel the character's anguish and suffering.

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens ö really do not do it justice . I read them all but most are so very general in that they do not tell you anything of interest. This review does. Barnens' first book, Lärarna, has a short introduction but is worth reading. In Swedish and English. In English it is quite readable. It does a great job of putting you into the characters' shoes. This book is about a young man's relationship with an older woman, who, for better or for worse, decides he will never have sex with her.

This is a funny movie. The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but I doubt it will make enough money. Deniro proves he can be a great Straight man again with some hilarious and spontaneous moments. Eddie was fun to watch working with people instead of CGI animals and rodents. Rene Russo- well she's just fun to watch anyway and she's played her part excellent.Some wild and unusual stunts, especially the garbage truck scene. This was worth seeing in the theater. We needed a good laugh and got many from the movie and the great out-takes at the end.

Between sweeping , extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded in Indian culture. This is an experience that you will want to share with all your friends. So, let’s begin! This story is a love story between two people, a boy and a girl. In this story, you will see the love story between two children. In all the scenes of this story, I have done the best I could. The entire film was shot with the use of real life location, which also helped a lot to make it authentic.

My favorite show of all time ! Yeah , I thought this was so cool , and Larisa Oleynik was so very cute in the show . And I really love how she looks when she's playing with them . She can act so well . : ) It's so cool because she's really talented ! I would like to see all the other ones , cause i really like the show , and i like how she looks in each of the shows , but she's so adorable , I just want to watch all the other ones .

inspite of many movies dealing with great artists or a genius, chihaweseon pointed out the real dilemma in which an artist is capted...the decision whether to ease the demands of the popularity or to create something new and to define ones' own style.Chiahweson's desperate seek for inspiration and broadening his conscious led him to live the way he did, restless, outrageous, and yes very drunk! But still he defended and retained the most important ethical rules for an artist: respect to his Master, respect to the nature and the gradual seek for improvement and to perfection.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's very exciting because you can do the thing that you love most, but it also make you realize what love truly means and what you 're actually doing to the people that you love .I love this book because it 's very different from the others in this category.This story was told in a very unique way, it is not a typical story in a book. It is something that you need to experience in a different manner. This story is about love.

In the first transformation scene , what is the music ? I 've heard it was `` The Greeks Do Rock 'n` Roll ``. In the second transformation scene , does that song come up ? I 've heard it was `` When You Wish upon A Star ``. When you wish for a star, you 've got two options. You can look up into the sky and hope you get one of the right ones that night and hope you don 't meet a star that wasn 't the right one for that particular night. That is the second option.

A great movie. The movie was even better then the commercials put on. And believe it or not it was very very inspirational. I really think anyone who walks out of the movie at the end will be inspired one way or another.It was kinda corny at the very beginning, but quickly picks up. I laughed. I laughed very hard on some parts. The acting is basically above average, nothing special, but better then average. I can safely say it was the second funniest movie to come out this summer (1st funniest being CLERKS II).

I saw this movie on it's opening night, and enjoyed it. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't been sitting by my father. My father saw the original (unfortunately, I have not seen it yet) and kept talking through the whole thing. He kept saying that the movie sucked, and that it was stupid. The thing is, he didn't understand that the creators were slightly making fun of the horror genre with the film. In every horror movie, there is always a certain character depicted.

A very weird, psychedelic, esoteric, (and did I say weird? :) experience.But on at least on one level - it did exactly what it was supposed to do. It bridged the gap between the silly, manufactured, Hollywood look at teen pop idols that was the Monkees TV program and the adult, musically growing and evolving, and yet still a little silly Monkees of the '70s and beyond.The most important line in the film is Mike Nesmith's, "If they think we are plastic now, wait till they see how we do it."

I never heard of architect , Louis Kahn , until this documentary . In this almost two hour documentary which covers the history of the building in which the name of Kahn is first recorded, Kahn is the first architectural genius ever to be born . The documentary was screened at TED in 2005 and the film was also shown at the Venice Film Festival. The film is a must for the architectural history buffs. This building is a symbol of the modernist spirit in the 20th century. Built in 1921 by Louis Kahn , the tower is a landmark in its own right.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the guest line-up, this is a show I am very proud of. With so many people performing at the same time, it makes you have a great time listening to them, and we do ! It's been a while since our last broadcast on the channel, so it was a good time to revisit the show we were working on back in May ! It was so much fun to make the show with our friends, especially Rupert and Linda , who really got us talking!

I remember this film of old. It's a great, chilling, atmospheric horror picture about a man who moves into a Scottish castle, only to discover that there are strange goings-on in the corridors at night. And there are even stranger events taking place out back, in Hollywood's most familiar hedge maze. Yes, this is the maze you've seen in every feature-length film that ever involved a topiary puzzle, up to and including "The Shining." But the punchline to this story is about the last thing you would guess. I certainly didn't see it coming.

This was a riveting film , one that really drew me in . I 'm a big fan of William Friedkin's films since they are often about a man coming out of prison and going down to his family in New Orleans to seek his fortune. His brother, a successful insurance agent, sets out on a business trip to the southern U.S. , and his brother-in-law's son dies of AIDS. When the film was released it got a lot of good reviews, including a rave review by Richard Roeper who called it a master class in the writing of a modern-day tragedy, and the director's masterpiece.

This is one of my favorite films, ever. The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so good. Unlike the other Disney films of the age, this film never bores the audience. 101 Dalmations, Peter Pan, Robin Hood, they were all good, but lack what we have here. This is funny, creative, and always on target. This movie just has an extra something that you can't learn in books. However, this is not the best animated film ever made. That title belongs to the BRILLIANT Toy Story.

When the Romulans come, they will not be bearing gifts; no, they bring with them war - war and conquest. As any familiar with this episode know, it is a redux of the war film "The Enemy Below" from the fifties. The obvious difference is that instead of a battleship and a submarine (or an American Destroyer & German U-boat) engaged in lethal war games, it is two starships in outer space. In Trek history, about 100 years before the events here, according to this episode, Earth fought the Romulan Wars.

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London ( England ) . Enjoyed it with some good old British humour and laughter. I'm a big movie fan, but I do like to see a decent film with some fun and humour. This was no different and I was glad I had a quiet night and a decent film to look forward too. The plot is predictable at times. There is no character development in it and it takes too long for the audience to become invested with the character. It is quite a long story and there is no resolution.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time . Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. I'm pretty sure there were some parts in it I did not understand and could not make it work. I think that the biggest problem I have with the movie and I don't even know if this is a valid criticism or not, but it's very repetitive. I kept thinking "this movie is not supposed to be this long". The only good part of the film is the first act. It's the only part I did get it.

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man , a young girl , a group of children , an old , mysterious lady . The movie is called "The Curse of the Blood Monster". And it is based on a story that is still being told today . It was the first time I had seen a horror film with a young girl . This time around , it was an eight-year-old girl . But I must say , this film is so dark , that I would rather watch the older version.

It was a terrific movie ! I like to watch it again and again . The actors were awesome . The film was well made . There were some bad acting and some bad script . But the film was well made and good story . Good story , good actor . I liked all in this movie and enjoyed it . I think it will be a big hit on television and DVD ! It was well made , a good film but I don't know how it would work in the theatre . The director is very good . I think it was worth seeing .

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the first draft. This is a story about a teenager who gets caught up in a world he didn’t understand. He had been raised in a home without religion, so when he realizes his life is being dominated by people who believe what they want to believe he goes to the movies, and finds that his life has nothing to do with it. His parents have no idea what he is going through or what the world really is, as they live in America.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

A well written screenplay . A moving story showing the middle class English at it 's best . Some great characters , good music , a decent love story and a lot of emotion in the end . This film has a story that has been seen in many movies before , this time with some great actors in the lead . It was a great film from start to the end . The movie had many emotions . The acting and writing was well done . Great film , worth to see again. I give the movie a good rating because it showed us what it is like to be in the middle class .

A film about the relationship between a man and leopard that 's very reminiscent of `` The English Patient ,`` but the main attraction in this version is not an animal, but the way in which a leopard turns the human into a man. The English Patient (1960), the only film ever produced on the leopard, also features the actor Robert Shaw in his last role, playing a doctor who takes on leprosy in the same manner as the film ```The Man Who Came to Dinner ``(1963).

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade . She smokes and drinks . She does n't have a lot of girlfriends because she doesn't give a shit if someone likes her

Jade isn't your average girl. In fact, Jade's not even your average person. She is, instead, a woman who doesn't give a shit about the people she doesn't like. Not that Jade didn't have a lot of lovers, but she only cares about one man. She's that girl who sits in her car in the parking lot at work. She does that a lot.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo' (hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door'), and was very impressed by both it's dreamy & occasionally surreal tale of a family that immigrates from Sicially to the U.S. in the early days of the 20th century. It also worked as a (proverbial)middle finger jammed into the eyeball of Homeland Security (preferably all the way up to the 3rd knuckle),in it's depiction of the ill treatment of foreigners who just want a better life than they were getting from their original mother land.

Then again , I like Rachael Ray . She is fun , sweet , fresh , and such a joy to watch on TV . I like that she has done so many good things in this world , and I like that she has no agenda . She is so very different from the ones I grew up with in the 80's . I like her humor , her honesty , and her sense of humor . She doesn't sugar coat everything . There are so many reasons why I like her , but this is the one I love . So , she is a fun person .

Let me clarify that . This is not a `` good movie '' , but I am so glad it has made it on to your list. I hope I can be a part of helping out on the set and seeing it. I can see this as a ``great movie '' or even ``not so good movie '' . I would be delighted to have the chance to help out on the set of this movie. I know it is well made and has a great storyline. I am just a little unsure about my involvement on the set as it could cause problems.

`` Showtime '' is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro ( Meet the Parents , A Bronx Tale ) and Michael Cera and is the first of the four films to come to theaters in the summer of 2006. Synopsis 
The film centers on three friends, played by Cera and DeNiro, who run a local restaurant. All three have to deal with a bad situation at the restaurant. The first movie is set to begin filming next month. The second movie starts filming in April. The third movie will start filming in September. Cast

 Robert DeNiro as John Fritter
 Michael J.

( Synopsis ) Graduating high school senior Bartleby `` B '' Gaines ( Justin Long ) finds himself without a job and without a college degree. He is desperate, and in desperate measures he tries to win back some of the attention his parents have turned to his younger brother, a troubled young drug dealer. Unfortunately, Bartleby does not have much to go on, other than the fact that he lives with his family and that his family is in a state of financial and emotional breakdown. So what can he do?

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title . The movie was cool , despite some of the problems with the original, which I will discuss in a later post , The movie is very well done and I give it a 4 out of 5 for a good remake . All in all this movie is not to bad . You should definitely watch this movie , but watch it on your laptop or in your dvd player , just make sure it goes on fast , I did not enjoy the original , so there are a few instances where I had to fast forward .

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan , where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion . In my opinion , the film isn't bad , it just doesn't have the impact or impact that I hoped it would have . I am still trying to work out why I love the film so much . If you have a chance to see it , give Blind Spot a try , as it will make you laugh and you may find it interesting. Tuesday, December 29, 2013

Last week , I went to a movie in Coyoacan to see Blind Spot.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time. Top 20 of my lifetime. I laughed more than I have since Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and cried more than I have since I saw The Notebook. If you are looking for a touching movie without the sappy edge...this is the one. It is real and powerful. See it and you won't regret it. I was reluctant at first and I only watched it because I had to do a school project about speech disabilities. But this movie is so much more than that.

OK, so I loved Rachael Ray before, but now, I ADORE her! How innovative. I love that she has a cooking section- I admit that occasionally I skip that part, only because it makes me WAAAY too hungry! But I also love that you can get the next day's grocery list on her website. I love that she has regular helpers and that she's made some of her viewers become her regulars. I love how personable she is and how creative she is. I also like how she does her Mystery Guests.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline . I go to the movies now as I do not like to think of myself a movie buff. In a way I suppose I am very much a movie buff. I think that watching movies is the only thing that I have always been able to spend time on in my entire life. It’s what I do. It’s what has shaped my life in many ways and I do it with no particular interest in what the storyline might be about, so I will not dwell on that here.

What a surprise . A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor ' only naughtier . Funny guy that he is , but no one should be expecting that he would turn out to be anything but the nutter he really is , and that he was actually born on the cusp of what we now call the '70s . It all started when this guy with a face that reminded him of a monkey was asked by some friends what his favorite food was, he replied " Anything that makes you go nutty ". And that is what he has been doing , so far , all of the nuttiest things .

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre . Set in Italy in 1932, the film is an early entry into a long line of Fulci horror films that would end up in his goreplasmic trilogy. In terms of story, this early film has a very good plot that is a bit slow, and it has some great characters and effects that are really well done. In terms of effects, this early film has some pretty great and memorable effects, like when a man is dragged up by the hair and strangled.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I 've seen in a very long time. I don't want to get into spoilers. There's a good chance this will be seen by everyone as well. However, I thought I should write this anyway, as I have watched it for the first time in a long time, and that's a very rare thing. For those that aren't familiar, here's the thing: the first ten minutes is a very funny thing.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time. It has an original script, talented cast and it delivers an hour and a half of pure unadulterated fun.It tells the story of a high school graduate Bartleby "B" Gains (Justin Long) who is not accepted in any of the collages he applied to, so to avoid his parents' disappointment he creates a fictional collage. In the attempt to fool his parents completely he creates a fake website and turns an old psychiatric hospital into a school.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen . Clearly not that many because it only grossed $1.6M in the opening weekend. The film was released on September 30, 2009 in the U.S. in 2D and was released in the UK on December 4, 2009 on DVD and Blu-ray and in 2D in 2011. It is now available in the USA in 2D, 2.35, and Blu-ray. Plot: An aristocratic family lives in a mansion in Greece, which has been usurped by the son of one of the family. This family is called the Aristorcats and they live peacefully with their servants.

I'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci's films. Most of his 80s gore films had their moments, but often came across as second-rate Dario Argento imitations. With the exception of the entertaining "Zombi" (which was a George Romero imitation), I didn't really enjoy them. I know Italian horror often disregards the plot, but the storyline and characters in his films were just far too thread bare even by the standards. This is why "Don't Torture a Duckling" surprised me. Its actually a very well made film with an engrossing murder mystery.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort , and Charlie Chaplin was no exception . In 1915, Chaplin’s A Night in Casablanca (starring John Gilbert) was a hit. It was released in 1915 and made $25,000 at the box office. The film is said to be one of Charlie’s most popular of all time . This film was made with a budget of $4 million, but Chaplin and his business partner, Jules Stoppard , managed to turn that into $24 million in revenue .

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to boot camp, where he has to learn how to handle his rifle and how to walk in line. That's a really funny scene as the tramp is not used to keeping his feet straight!Next thing you know he's in France in a trench. Hilarious scenes here include a starving Charlie eating the cheese of a mousetrap and reading a letter from home over someone's shoulder.When Charlie goes to sleep he finds his bunker all flooded and his roommate snoring.

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

In an early scene , Luca ( David Pasquesi ) and James ( Jeff Garlin ) are walking down a street when a group of men attack. James, thinking they’re muggers, tries to intervene. Luca, on the opposite side, sees him as a “chicken” and shoots him in the head. But the scene is cut before James can react. He thinks it’s the end of an ordinary day at the office and is surprised when the men start shouting, and the camera pulls back in order to show more violence.

As with so many modern US films , there has to be a supernatural element to the plot , but the supernatural element here would have to be subtle and in a way that does not disturb the viewer too much. You have to admire the creative team who have used such a dark and disturbing theme to tell a gripping story, and they have done it without making the viewer sick. This film doesn’t lack for suspense either, because it is a thriller with a dark undertone, which means that the film will keep you wondering and wondering what will happen next , and how will things go.

Undoubtedly one of the best episodes ever , Balance of Terror is 45 minutes of well executed suspense , with a plot full of twists and surprises that you never see coming . The first thing that gets you is the scene where they set up a trap and the rest of the episodes are like that but this was much better than the rest

The only thing that I noticed was that every episode was so predictable. I know that there are some episodes where we get more surprises than the others but it was not enough for me to enjoy this episode.

A labor of love. Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you. Then the sheer emotion and story-telling take you through a dream that stays with you long after the movie. The director gets your heart and leads it through 100 minutes of visual poetry. You are a part of the emotional ride of the characters. I have seen this movie at 2 festivals and it got with standing ovations at every showing. The remarkable story-telling transcends nationality and language and I felt I was a part of the drama unfolding before me. The casting is as perfect as one can get.

First off, I absolutely loved this movie. As a Billy Crystal fan, I must say that I was expecting more comedic situations than I actually got. However, it was nice to see him in a role with more depth and emotion. His portrayal of talent agent Sammy was brilliantly performed and uniquely him. In addition, Gheorghe Muresan (as Maximus) was superb in his first film role. When Sammy goes to Romania to visit his client on location he has his world turned upside down. He never expected that he would accidentally find the one person who could change his life.

`` Pearl Harbor , buddy . '' This movie is brilliant ! Sure it does n't exactly flow like an 80's movie but there's so much life in its characters and the way it's written , you can feel it all from the get go . The story of this movie is based on real history and it is based on historical events . You don't just have the names of the ships and names of crew , you really have the real history . You see it as a character and you feel all the history that happened .

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families by stowing away on an outbound ship. They think that if they successfully make the voyage they can better their lives by making enough money in New York to send for their families. Unfortunately for them, the ship that they select is a rundown Russian freighter which has already been heavily fined at a previous port for harboring stowaways. The captain and the first mate are determined not to let this happen again as their jobs are on the line.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling, but the film is a masterwork of a very different nature. It shows a man who was a true master of film, not so much by his technique, but by his manner of working with film on a larger scale. As we look through his work and through the early days, it's hard to say how many of the films we've been shown were actually produced in the years from 1929 to 1933.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode , beside Peter Falk , you have Julie Newmar , who had to go back to work after being cast as Missy in a Broadway show , as well as a new character named Maxine , who was introduced in a later episode. But this Columbo episode begins with Peter Falk , who is asked to explain himself to the viewers about the murder investigation. His explanation will be his last one. After this episode airs, we get to know much more about the investigation.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film, like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles, as just another patchwork of mindless violence. And while there is a fair amount of mayhem, DEATH WISH 3 is not that awful of an effort, particularly for fans of the series and its star.This time out, aging Charlie's Paul Kersey is let loose by a police chief desperate to clean up a rough part of New York City. The trigger-happy vigilante moves into the heart of gang territory, where he once again becomes a one-man army in an urban war of good versus evil.

Without going into any details of a good ... if a somewhat provocative ... TV movie , there seems to be a growing number of films based upon a true story that may have a chance of making it big . One such example is the TV movie "Troy" starring Will Smith , a film that was recently released to theaters . Based upon the true story of the real life child rape of a 13 year old high school student , the film focuses on a young boy named Troy Davis , who was convicted of raping a young girl while a student at a local high school .

i did not read the book. nor do i care to. the movie was a beautiful romance, and i think women will enjoy it. no, it was not a "10" film, but it was enjoyable. women, if your man is bored as mine was, then watch it yourself. hurt is wonderful as the philosophic doctor who delivers a thoughtful monologue on "in love" and "loving. "also, if you like nick cage, he was terrific and funny. i enjoyed watching the developing romance. also, if you like Christian bale -- do see him in equilibrium.

I was n't expecting a great deal from this film , so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it. I found it very easy to follow , the dialogue flowed well, and I found the acting of the whole cast very good , with a few minor issues . This is a film that is well done and I loved it . I highly recommend it . The movie is very entertaining , there are many funny lines and the cast does a good job with their roles . Highly recommended . The picture looks good in HD .

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind ever made . . . »

And it really does have the power : it was the last great motion picture of the decade, it made audiences feel like they were watching something truly incredible, and, of course, it is a very big deal in film-history circles. The film was the last of a rare breed : a film that had the power to affect the lives of the general public and even the cinema world in a direct and dramatic manner.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character. The humour is very much a 'like it or love it' brand of totally politically incorrect, irreverent and self effacing type.Personally I totally love this film, and so has everyone i have met who has seen it. You can watch it several times and pick new gags up each time. The humour is both aural and visual, and the timing is impeccable. The humour is probably very English, and specifically London, so its possible that non-English viewers may not get some of the humour.

Even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing . In fact, they have managed to retain their unique style of songwriting. The band has released 15 albums and six compilation albums , and has been involved with a multitude of films and TV shows. However, they seem to have found a way to combine their talents, producing some of the most popular albums of the last two decades. As such, we decided to look back at ‘The Best of Black Sabbath: 20 Years On’ .

As I have said before, I am NOT a fan of Tweety. He's just so aggravating I wish Sylvester would just eat him and get it over with.In this cartoon Sly is homeless once again and is back to feeding out of garbage cans. He spots a cruise ship leaving port nearby and decides to hop aboard when he spys Tweety is one of the passengers. The ship provides an adequate stage for the following hijinks and Sly desperately tries to catch the annoying bird and avoid seasickness. If only for once he's succeed by chewing and swallowing, thus finishing of the irritating Canary forever.

I 've commented once on this Chucky great , but I had to do it again to say some things I haven't seen or thought of for a long time

First of all I don't have a problem with anyone who likes Chucky but I do have some problems with some people. I know that I was not one of them. I think a lot of the problems you have with the character are rooted in things you may have forgotten. I like chucky, I love his comic and I think he is one of the greatest comic characters ever made.

But a great cast! Jonathan Pryce, Kathy Bates, Rupert Everett, Lynne Redgrave, Julie Andrews and Dan Aykroyd! And that's just the beginning.I'm not totally sure that any description of the movie and plot are going to entice you to watch this one. Suffice it to say that it has something for practically everyone: death, singing, a sparkly suit, cell phones, a little person (nice looking woman, actually), a drawbridge (modern, not Medieval), a boombox, and a crossbow. Oh, and a psychotic.

I don't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch while I did. I got so engrossed I gave up working to just sit and finish watching the last half hour uninterrupted. And I sure don't usually shed tears over this sort of show, but I was crying at the end. A lot of emotional nuance. Great acting, and good southern feel. John Corbett is one of the most talented actors out there, and the guy who played Luke was really good too. Highly recommend.

I 've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months ( maybe longer but not much ) but it really hasn't really taken off. So I decided to go ahead and try this out on my own - I have seen the show before, but can't seem to remember where - so it's just me, this time. It's an awesome show because it's a great mix of old and new, so I am going to post a bunch of links, pictures and such to help you guys get to know the show - I promise I am not trying to steal anyone's ideas!

If you have n't seen this film , do it . Its a genremix as i 've never seen another like it , the story line are great , the acting is very great , the dialog is very good . A great film .The only thing that I can think is that its a little too fast for me to see it in its entirety . If you are looking for a film like this , then you should watch it , if you have not seen it , do it . It 's worth the watch . A wonderful film. I have always found that it is very well put together.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something, and who appreciate a farce that is clever enough for you to take it seriously, this movie will surprise you. It is not a 'whodunit' for people who can't aren't able to follow the verbal exchange of our hero, Professor Dexter Cornell (Dennis Quaid).Cornell teaches in Southern California, near the tar pits. He has not published a novel in four years, his wife is divorcing him, he drinks a bit much, and is blessed or cursed with caustic wit, which he freely dispenses to his students.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie. But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. (MINOR SPOILERS) As per usual, the main character, B, is the sane one of the bunch. B has this crazy idea to make up his own college when he's rejected from all colleges he applies to. He's known for making fake IDs. so an acceptance letter is no problem.Because B's dad is a hard @$$ and suspicious of this university he's never heard of, B gets his friend Sherman to design a website for the university.

I am a guy , so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Geary is not a nice guy. I know he is good and i know his character is bad, but i was not prepared for so much abuse. But he wasn't horrible, i really thought he was really nice, but i still have to wait to see what he has to say. And i really, really wanted him to be really good. And it seems like all his scenes in the movie are horrible.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen! The images that are shown are absolutely breathtaking and stunning. On top of that, it is a wonderful learning experience. I'm not one for educational documentaries, but this one grabs hold of you and doesn't let go until the end. You'll be so hooked and entranced by what you are watching that you'll forget your at home watching TV! This series is available to buy on DVD and I HIGHLY recommend picking this one up!

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, I believe, or Netflix. Here's one that I saw recently, but haven't really seen before. It's about a police detective who investigates serial killer's. The movie has some strong acting, and a well-constructed thriller-like plot. The last time I saw a true-crime movie, it was a good one, but definitely not a best-film-I've-seen. If you haven't seen it, I suggest you go watch it soon. It's worth it!

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families in search of a better life. They set sail in a small boat and are caught in a raging storm that sweeps them across several hundred miles of sea. As their ship crashes into a lifeboat, their captors murder most of the men and then throw them overboard to try to escape. Only one of the survivors is an African named Peter, and the others are Europeans. The characters are very different. One is an older man who works with his uncle as a doctor in an African slum in Paris.

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons , and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out . I must have watched a hundred and twenty episodes and it’s been over a decade since the last one. I’m not here to discuss what the Simpsons has done in terms of plot and character development, or what it means to me what they’re doing in this season and the season before. I want to talk about what is the most memorable part of each episode, the thing that I feel makes me go back to that episode time and time again.

Jeff Garlin's film is filled with heart and laughter. As in Curb Your Enthusiasm, his screen persona is hilarious; but in addition we get to see both warmth and a sense of emotional vulnerability that makes the story universal. While the film chronicles his character's dreams of love, performing success, and weight loss, it will appeal to anyone who dreams of a better life. The supporting cast brings the frustrations and joys of his life to the screen in funny and heartbreaking ways. The simple joys of food, friendship, and trying once again once life has disappointed us are all themes.

A Formula For Murder isn't a well known Giallo, but that isn't to say it's not a very good one! The film is directed by Alberto De Martino, the man behind cult classics such as The Antichrist and Blazing Magnums. The film was released late on in the Giallo cycle, but more than stands up to many of the films released around the 'golden' period in the early seventies. Despite a lack of logic in some areas, the film works mainly due to the competent way it mixes Argento style death scenes with some genuinely surprising plot twists, and a host of well defined characters.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie . It follows all the conventions of a traditional documentary, but it’s really a narrative. A narrative is a story with a linear beginning, a middle and an end, and there are lots of them. An example of a traditional documentary would be the opening credits for a movie about a car accident, where you’d see the accident happening right away and you’d learn more about its cause and effect. A narrative is different, though.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

OK , so I loved Rachael Ray before , but now , I ADORE her ! How innovative . I love this woman , I feel that I'm in her inner circle . This is sooo funny , it's great ! I can tell that this woman is truly in love . I feel that all women are , I can relate to the fact that we all want something different from our boyfriend , but when they find that person that we love , they can't imagine the feeling , I just want to laugh with my friends . Hi Rachael Ray.

where do we go from here ? that is the overriding question of this film . And make no mistake, it is not an ordinary thriller. I dont want to speak of the story, which is an interesting one and I do not want the title to be a cliché. The film was made as an action thriller ,and I think it is a genre that works best on a wide screen or in a big screen. The film follows a young woman who goes to work for a mysterious billionaire in order to find a missing plane.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another Hollywood thriller with a pretty decent plot . In reality, this is one of the rare films that is actually as good a crime drama as it is a horror picture . And it is one of only a few films made during the Golden Age of Horror, which is usually reserved for the early ’80s . With this movie in the ‘50s, the genre had reached a level of sophistication that it never had before .

James Franco is totally cool in this movie. Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a sincere kind of way. At the Tristan screening some folks were on his back for being pouty and sullen and doing the whole James Dean thing but I don't think this true. Blind Spot is proof positive of his tremendous talent. In this film he carries himself with a different sort of weight entirely. It's a unique performance. Bittersweet and really moving. The lines from his journal cut you like a knife. You sense a sharp intelligence of observation behind his words.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature . Faulkner mostly wrote about the Civil War . But his most famous novel, The Sound and the Fury , is a scathing indictment of slavery. Faulkner died on June 1, 1943 at his home in Florida. His ashes were scattered near the sea at St. Augustine, Florida . Faulkner’s ashes were returned to his home, where he was laid to rest in the cemetery with two other Civil War veterans, General James Longstreet and General Leonidas Polk.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie ( I have lived here my whole life and I am always up for an adventure ), there has been the question of whether this was the place to stay or the place to go for the filming. After all, you have the ocean, the sand, and the sun on your face from sunrise until sundown. So, the question was asked and the answer was YES. In the past several years, the house was renovated and expanded to accomodate the additional guest/crew members.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous death scenes ! I have never had such a good time since I started watching horror movies a few years back. It's a horror movie where a young couple is haunted by their mother's ghost who is watching over them from the bathroom. The young couple decides to try and get rid of their mother and they try several different ways . . . until the ghost comes to the couple and tells them she has come for their mother. All the characters are very well developed.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC . I 've been looking for it ever since . It was a good show . But I just can not get it . I am a huge fan of David Cross's writing , and of the show . However I don't think Borderline is a show that I will ever see , nor one I would recommend to anyone

I think I might see it , maybe in the theater or at a festival like Cannes , or something . I also think I would have to see it to understand it . I don't think I could put down the entire script .

Based on a William Faulkner short story, Two Soldiers is a top notch short film, a movie that has enough story, emotion and great cinematography for a feature film and definitely leaves you wanting more in the end. The story involves two dirt poor Mississippi brothers, one only a kid, the other old enough to volunteer for the war effort shortly after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The younger brother, played brilliantly by newcomer Jonathan Furr, doesn't want to let his older brother go, and he sets out on a quest to enlist in the Army himself.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious . Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull guy had great hair that was perfect for the cartoon . Great job to everyone involved in creating this great cartoon that will be remembered for a long time. I've watched this show before and this cartoon was better than the movie. The graphics are awesome and the character designs are nice. This was a nice movie with some great special effects, but nothing to really distinguish it from the other movie, which it was. I thought the animation in this was great and it really looked nice.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of `` L'Anticristo '' ( 1974 ) , this one begins with a bang and never lets up until the very last frame. It takes a while to get going and the viewer will find themselves wondering whether this is a movie they will like or not. We have the usual plot device - a mad priest who has been hiding away from society. Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the elements necessary to be an effective episode of this type.The action scenes are well-done, with a great sense of suspense from the opening sequence, and a fantastic final scene. There are a number of points where the Columbo episodes are superior to this episode. For instance, in the opening scenes of both these shows, the audience knows what to expect from the series, and what is coming, but that doesn't happen in this episode.

I do n't care what some of the reviews said , this movie was funny . Undoubtedly one of the best episodes ever, Balance of Terror is 45 minutes of well executed suspense, with intelligent real-world parallels (the title refers to a situation very similar to what was going on between the US and the Soviet Union during the Cold War), spot-on characterizations and the introduction of Star Trek's second most important hostile alien race after the Klingons: the Romulans. After receiving a distress call from a Federation outpost, the Enterprise is dangerously close to the Neutral Zone which, if crossed, would lead to open conflict with the Romulans, although no one has ever actually seen them in the flesh.

At one time ` Buddy Cop ' movies ruled the box office . It seemed that every summer flocks of moviegoers gathered in theaters across the country to spend hundreds of thousands of dollars at the theater’s front door for a ticket. The only problem? There’s not a whole lot of the ticket money that went into the box office. So the studios had to take a page from the movies of yore and put a little more cash into the theater coffers . But now the studios are facing something much more insidious: the threat of a bankruptcy.

SHOWTIME is a mess, but it's an entertaining mess. The plot is forgettable, the satire is lightweight and the action sequences, though well-staged, aren't that exciting. But I laughed. A lot. Credit goes to the inspired pairing of De Niro and Murphy. They have great chemistry. Murphy delivers the one-liners, De Niro cracks us up with a look or grimace. This movie will get a RUSH HOUR-like reception from the critics. Don't listen to them. If you're a fan of De Niro or Murphy, you're going to enjoy this movie.

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special `` Simpson 's Roasting On An Open Fire '' which had the title of the episode of the season. Then in the mid-1970s it became the longest running episode of television of all time, even topping out with two minutes of commercials. It also spawned the show of the same name. In that year, the Simpsons was named the most watched television program of the year by the Nielsen company according to television critics. Not only that but it won the Emmy for Outstanding Special Class Program.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature. Faulkner mostly wrote about life in the South particularly during the depression years. Many of his stories have been adapted to screen. Short stories like Two Soldiers is an endearing tale of two brothers in December 1941 after the attack on Pearl Harbor. The older brother, Pete Greer, goes to Memphis, Tennessee to enlist like hundreds of thousands of young men, some who would never come home. His younger brother doesn't take his departure well. He manages to get a bus ticket to Memphis without any money to find his brother.

i did not read the book . nor do i care to . the movie was a beautiful romance , and i wish i could have seen more . the book is so beautifully written . one thing that bothered me , and i'm not talking about the author, is that it was too slow in the book , not like the movie . a few times there was not enough action , a lot of romance , but nothing amazing . i wish that if a movie made from the book was made , that it was made more like the book.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman : TAS and its ilk , I enjoyed it in spite of it being only a couple of minutes long. I think the problem here is that the story feels like a bit of a filler, it’s more a series of vignettes than a plot in itself and it ends up being less than satisfying overall. Still, a great example of great animation that isn’t about being over the top.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt , My parents loved it. I remember watching it from my front porch in the summertime, when the weather was still nice and warm. The `` old dark house '' sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the film. I'd be remiss, as an aficionado, to leave out The Dark House: A Tale Of Terror From Outer Space . There is a reason it hasn't received much of an R rating; it isn't as much as a horror movie as it is more of a science fiction. The story is set around an alien race called the Kzinti, who have colonized a remote planet and are living peacefully. The inhabitants of the planet, The Kzinti, were once the rulers of the world.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . If you remember the 1974 film then you will remember Kersey was a " Conchie " during the Korean war and that he was physically sick after he committed his first execution . Ten years later Kersey seems to have learned unarmed combat and how to handle anti tank weapons in his spare time . But I`ll overlook that gaffe because DW3 is the best of the sequels , lowlife scum bags get shot dead , burned alive , their teeth smashed , and thrown to their deaths by middle aged housewives armed with sweeping brushes .

This film, winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 (tied with P.T. Anderson for Punch-Drunk Love), is about a 19th century Korean painter with a commoner's roots and significant impact on Korean painting. One of the strengths?of the film is that Im tries to help us see with the eye of a painter, so we see multiple scenes and objects which help our drunken painter friend, Jang Seung-up (Choi Min-shik),?receive inspiration.The costumes and the art direction are all impressive and the acting is even along being good.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's accused of not being the kind of director the audience actually wants to see , but rather of trying to impose his will on them in his own film. I don't necessarily mean that he's a hack , but rather the opposite, a true professional whose work is not only great , but also completely unscripted , non-stop action and blood and gore . He's a director who 's approach to his art has always allowed his movies to feel fresh and true , and without any of the predictable tropes and trappings .

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

Like a few people I know, I came in late on 'Stingers'; not until 2000. Three years later there is no way I'd miss an episode. The show really is that good and has, for a better word, maintained its integrity, unlike 'Blue Heelers', for example. The crime is the thing; personal lives are there but only wheeled out when affecting an investigation! When Gary Sweet was brought in, some fans seemed worried, but he's really fitted in well, which didn't surprise me.

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

Coming from the "druggie" generation, I thought this movie was hilarious. It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde up-to-date, so to speak. My husband and I laughed all the way through it. No. I'm not kidding with this one. He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave this movie positive marks. And who can blame him? I'm not going to go into too much depth, but Showtime was a pretty funny movie. There wasn't any slapping-your-knee funny scenes (that I can remember), but it had it's moments. People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the outcome, and they will have to be disappointed for a good reason. The story of the film is pretty much exactly what we expected, and there are still plenty of holes. So, what is the actual movie? Well, there are two major plot lines going into the film:

Plot A The first plot line takes place after the events of M.A.N.T.I.S., and the main character’s mission to find out what happened is a fairly straight-forward thing.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave . I 'm happy with that , but as the days pass SCREAM has become a mere legend of it's own fame . I remember the first time I saw SCREAM , I fell in love . That's all I remember about it . I had no expectations as to its popularity . To be honest I thought it was a waste of time and money , but as I kept on reading I found it very intriguing . And to be honest , after that I was hooked on it .

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development . Fulci was a master at creating horrific characters, and there were many who could have been easily scared off by his style. However, that did not stop him from having his way with his audiences, and that’s fine. What I liked most about this flick is the way it managed to be a bit edgy. At one point I wondered if it would become a bloodfest, and I wonder how much of Fulci’s career he would have been remembered had it not been for the graphic violence in the film.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years. On the contrary, I was more impressed now than in my callow youth with its honesty and brave humour. In 1969, the transition among African-American groups from a predominant policy of conciliation and integration to one of confrontation and self-determination was still quite new, and more than a little controversial. It took courage and finesse to portray both the Establishment and the Anti-establishment as the caricatures they often closely approximated in real life. Special mention should be made of Arnold Johnson's performance: he successfully avoided having his character lapse into either sociopathy or buffoonery.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius . And this movie is good ! Although the film does n't nearly reach its potential as I am sure any good movie should. The performances are fantastic, as well as the script . This is one of those movies that you feel as if you've seen all of its potential and more ! I don't like many of my movies, but this one I think is fantastic . I will give it a few more views, but that's it . The story line is interesting but I don't think its worth a few more view.

Not a stunner , but a good movie to see once or twice . Bill Macy shows he can do it again . I saw it once and thought it was pretty nice.
