Separate LIES changed my life . Actually , the Q & A did.SPOILERS BELOW . Read only if you watch the movie in question . I was told the truth about being with my husband and I told them that I was pregnant. I knew that if they knew I was pregnant, I would be charged with murder . I felt so dirty and guilty . My life was in shambles. I was so ashamed to be with my husband and I couldn't even have an abortion because it would have caused a huge scandal and I didn't think it would happen to a pregnant woman .

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the mandolin player. And, as always, the mandolin player is a lovable guy. One of the best scenes that I could find in all of the movies is the mandolin playing "I'm on Fire" by the Eagles. Mandolin plays a big part in the film and it doesn't go unnoticed by Cage's character. But it's not just the playing of the mandolin that's notable in this movie. Cage also brings out the role of Cage's character in a different light.

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

The writers of lost have outdone themselves . Season two 's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the first season's. With so many unresolved plotlines, it's hard not to feel for each character in the finale, and I think it's more than a little weird that they were able to keep the show going on this long. So it's not a surprise that the show ended up with a strong finale. However, what's also surprising is that, with all of the major characters having left by this point, the finale felt more like the end than the beginning.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film? Probably someone. But no-one, truly no-one, could ever compare their expectations with the amazingly emotive and powerful performance given by the two actors in this film.Michael (Steven Robertson) lives in a home for disabled people. He has Cerebral Paulsy, and as shown to us right at the beginning, he has huge trouble communicating. So it truly is a lifeline when fellow disabled member Rory (James McAvoy) who can speak normally, understands him.

`` Nuovomondo '' was a great experience . Many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue . But I think this is also the most important element . I wanted to try to give the audience just a fraction of the amount of story that could be expressed in the few minutes of dialogue . I'm not saying that this will be the last movie I write , it will be part of my body of work . And I want to give the audience just a glimpse of what they could expect in a film .

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh : as the Monkees reduce their entire career to making the greatest of all pop music, you're left wondering if the movie is actually all about the Monkees. Or, more importantly: what happened to the rest of them that we didn't see on screen? "I'm just trying to see if you can see me," Monkee Monkee says. His eyes and mouth are wide open, but there's something about the way he is speaking that puts you at ease.

I didn't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD. I knew it had a cult following but I had also seen a lot of the director's later works which although delightfully gory were also pretty much incoherent. DON'T TORTURE A DUCKLING actually had a linear storyline and a mystery that kept me guessing almost until the end. And after all was said and done, it was a genuinely unsettling and creepy experience. One major caveat: I would much rather have heard the original soundtrack and read English subtitles than the uneven dubbing found here.

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age,” says the actor. “I think I’ve got to go and see him again and say goodbye. But I will always love him.” He adds: “In the last years of his life he was getting very ill. I think that’s the reason why he did so much touring.”

Buddy was one of the top-ranking rock musicians of the 1960s and an icon to his fans and the world at large.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you 'll have the satisfaction of seeing something like this with your friends. This is the sequel to the awesome "The Avengers" movie from last week, so the cast of Avengers: Endgame is here too! The story of Endgame starts out with Tony Stark taking on the mantle of his father and trying to rebuild the Avengers with the help of his new wife (Scarlett Johansson, the actress who played Maria Hill), and with some help from his daughter Jane (Mackenzie Davis).

The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and if you follow its lead you're going to have a lot of fun (as long as you don't mind your murders served up really bloody, and your horror topped with extra cheese)!This film winks an eye at every horror fan, and then gives them the finger. It knows it sucks, and because of that, it's far and away the best of the "Child's Play" series. It plays up the "stoopid humor" angle so well, you find yourself doing more than just laughing AT it, but WITH it.

At first I didn't think I would like this movie, but as it progressed it became better and better. I love music and I was impressed with how well Cage could fake the movements of playing a mandolin. My son was with me and he also like the movie a lot for its music and the story and the way the story unfolded--- slowly showing how Corelli won the girls heart. The acting and the story were both well done and well directed. At first Corelli's bravado was irritating, but soon he grew on you.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I 've ever seen on film . I do not know what the man thinks he is doing on that set, what he is up to and what he is trying to achieve, I only know he 's giving us something beautiful to look at which is all I can hope for at this stage of my life. This film, like much of their music, is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer. It is terrific and, in many ways, ahead of its time.The images are funny, disturbing, and at the very least, engaging. The music is amazing. This is not the "candy pop" sound they are unfortunately associated with. This is the sound of a band in exploration and revolt.HEAD, alone, should put The Monkees into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Can anyone tell me why these guys are not in there?

Better than it has any right to be , this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office, and with it the careers of all but a handful of performers. Not that it matters, since there aren't that many of them, but the film is still one of those that sticks with me. The plot was solid and the actors did pretty much all the heavy lifting themselves, but it all came together to be a mess. The problem is that the film's premise is just a little too broad for it to stick with.

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it ( typical Malibu Barbie ) but the rest of the actors are just so damn beautiful. It’s no surprise to me that everyone else in the film is also stunningly beautiful, but it really is nice to see how all the girls’ eyes and bodies are complimented. I love how all the girls in the film are beautiful (I can’t help but be a bit ashamed to say it, lol), but I just love it when they’re all so perfect in their looks (and they’re all so damn good at it!).

The last film by underrated director Alberto De Martino ("The Antichrist", "The Killer is on the Phone") is a truly suspenseful but incomprehensibly neglected giallo, containing pretty much all the trademarks that makes this Italian horror sub genre so magnificent and addictive to the fans. There are some very disturbing themes (child abuse, phony priests), loads of creepy moments, plot twists left & right, outstanding music and  last but not least  a handful of really sadistic murder scenes! Especially the opening sequence, which is some kind of prologue, is a powerful piece of horror!

Another enjoyable Warner flick. I really liked John Garfield in this, though I'm wondering why Cagney wasn't in the role. Perhaps it was too similar to ANGELS WITH DIRTY FACES? I mean, it's another Dead End Kids story of sorts too, but I really appreciated them here and this film had a lot of nice comical touches along with some good serious drama. The boys work great with Garfield. A nice sequence was the whole "swimming" scene which starts out with no cares but winds up coming too close to disaster.One negative comment: Claude Rains was grossly miscast.

I never thought I'd say this about a biopic, but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (especially concerning Kenji Miyazawa's emotions) and too little on the literal occurrences in his life--by the end, I'm not sure if he dies (he's supposed to), or if his sister finally dies (she's supposed to), or if the director spent a little too much time on the Galactic Railroad (that's an inside joke, in case you missed it--Miyazawa wrote a children's book called Night on the Galactic Railroad).

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan. Plot
Jimmy Dolan has been living with his brother and sister, who have separated from each other for years, and have recently started living with their aunt and uncle. As a teenager Jimmy had been drinking heavily and was arrested twice for fighting with another boy; both times they were acquitted, but he is now considered a danger to his family. His brother and sister still live together but they do not speak to each other, although they are still friendly.

I was 19 or 20 , years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City , Utah and I went to a friend’s birthday party that took place at the house of my friend and her sister. While there I danced and drank to the tunes on the radio . The party went on all night long and my friend was the one to put me up until 2 or 3 AM in the morning after which she went home alone. I woke up in the morning and there were 2 or 3 other guys there, with me and there was also another friend that was in the group with us .

it 's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar fight, a man is trying to find his way in life and a couple of old women. I think the music was very good, the acting was good too, and I enjoyed it. There were a few bits that weren’t as good as I thought they would be, but not that many that I would have preferred to see gone. All in all a nice little film with an enjoyable story line.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.

I 've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer , and I 'm glad to see it finally out in the world on blu ray ! It really does have its heart in the right place, but it fails to really hit the heights that it could have had, particularly in the first half-hour, when we see a lot of empty space in the timeline, and this doesn't do anything to change this. There is no real reason to want to see this film , and it is one of the best action film in the world today.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be. Terrible acting! Implausible scenerios! Ridiculous death scenes! Creepy, evil-for-no-reason villains! The last 30 minutes of this movie just might be the best 30 minutes ever put on film, especially in the scene where the decent, hardworking citizens string chains across the street, knocking down the evil bikers and then shoot them, only to be joined by the neighborhood children (!!!) in celebration. And how can I forget the elderly woman with the broom? She's sweeping out the scum!

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo ' ( hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door '). This is a movie that is so very, very, very good. I have been looking for it for many months. I think you should check it out... It is one of my favorites! It is so, so very, very, very, very, very, very good. I am so glad I have the chance to go to the premiere! It was a big crowd. It was a huge crowd.

The Monkees, surprisingly, are a big favorite of mine. Yes, they might have been the original manufactured rock band; a gimmick that certainly has reached overkill in the 21st century. However, their music holds up as some of the best the 1960's had to offer. Last Train To Clarksville, Daydream Believer, I'm A Believer, (I'm Not) Your Stepping Stone, Valleri and Pleasant Valley Sunday are great songs, written by good songwriters such as Boyce/Hart, Neil Diamond, Goffen/King and John Stewart.

I love this movie a lot . I must get this on DVD . I have 2 VHS copies , 1 of which i have burned to VHS tape , the other i have made a copy on video . I am so disappointed that they did not do a DVD release . The DVD release i have have been waiting to see for months . This was a movie everyone loved . Now its out of print and only has the DVD in it . This movie i wouldnt watch again . I can understand why the people did not like this movie . I know alot of people hated the movie .

OK , so this film may not have won any Oscars , but it is not a bad film . it may have some faults as well ,but still it is a fun film ,which was made with the same spirit , and as a whole it is really a fun film and a good film , I would recommend this to you and your friends , if you liked this film you would definitely recommend this film to other friends and also to the people you know who likes this kind of movies ,

What was your reaction when you saw this film?

Containing Billy's famous humor, this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure, pleasantly unexpectedly so for Billy Crystal. This movie has different tear-jerker, dramatic, serious underlying themes (particularly with a scene with Steven Seagal). This movie was both entertaining and serious, a movie about lost love, about relationships with father-son, husband-wife, about friendship and values with a good dose of humor thrown in, especially at the beginning. The balance between drama and comedy isn't always maintained as with the new classical genre of this type, but the real message and motivation for this movie remains solid.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

When I was 10 ( currently 14 ) , I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would be awful. So far, I've seen seven. I've been disappointed in each of them. There were a few exceptions, but they were rare. I've tried to learn from each of my mistakes, and I'd love to hear your experience. Thanks. The movie is a comedy, but that is what I think every film is about at that age. The comedy is not based in reality. Not sure what I thought would be the worst.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life , the action was great , and i thought i would never fall asleep but i did. The ending wasn't the best in that it didn't come to a conclusion , but overall I'm glad it ended on the right foot. It's not perfect, but it's the best one ever. If you liked this movie , check out all the other ones made for free by me. You will not be dissapointed. It's really a pleasure. And I will continue to keep updating this blog as I go along.

WTF!! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending?? The Notebook was good...but sheesh, enough with the depressing endings already. I'm told that he writes about realistic situations that people deal with in real life. Understandable...but sometimes it's nice to see people who have sacrificed their whole lives to only get to a mediocre unhappy time in their lives - to finally find the true meaning of happiness and are able to live it out for the rest of their days. Don't we already know what really happens in real life?

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house . . . with the lights out. And this is one of those movies where I want to laugh my way to the end. I'm going to tell you what I can remember, but you may not want to see the whole thing . . . or even all the way through, anyway. It's all pretty funny, but you're in for a treat. I promise you'll love it. I was talking to my mom.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it . It 's one of the best movies of this year because of the story that it told. I also liked it because of the cinematography. I would give the movie 4 out of 4. My rating will be based on my overall thoughts about this movie. Do let me know if I have made a mistake in my rating so that I may try to make a better one! Thanks for reading my blog, I look forward to seeing you!

Ah the Outer Limits . I love that show . It was surpremely creepy , or down-right mysterious . I liked it . So here is my own take . I think we have seen what it’s like to be inside the Mind of God. We have seen what it takes to survive. There are things we have never encountered, we have seen it and know it is possible. We have come to see what we are not, we are not what we see. I believe God has the power within us all to see and discover what He has to share with us.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I , which gave us Werner Herzog 's `` Lessons of Darkness ``? If it is not the same movie, then it is either a copy or a very early one. The title is `` The Last Battle `` and the first chapter is `` Night of the Eagle ``. If it is the `` Last battle ``, then it is not the only one. In the `` Final scene, you will see a scene from another movie and it is the beginning of a different film.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film . I have got to say that after seeing it I now think that maybe we could try to get this to the theaters to show to our younger audiences. I know this movie will be out next spring. But I would like some opinions from those of you who've seen it already. Thanks for reading. As you might know from reading my blog I grew up in New York City. I have always loved theater, it is a big part of my childhood. I love to see movies and see movies.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky ' is a `` return to greatness '' but the series was never really a sequel to the movie with that name. It was the first one that I saw after the movie. It was very entertaining. I really liked it when the movie was done. The reason I am saying that the movie did not become a sequel was because when it was released it had its own unique look. If you have not seen the movie, then it is more than worth your time and you will enjoy this series.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n' roll. The young singer/songwriter from Lubbock, Texas left his mark on the template of modern music. Inspired by Elvis Presley, Holly would spend a lot of time fighting the system in order to get his rock-a-billy sound recorded. Before his untimely death, he was mixing lush strings with be-bop rhythms. Holly would take his place with Presley, Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis and Ricky Nelson as the voices of teenage angst.This easy to watch bio is not without flaws.

I know this movie is n't for everyone , and I wo n't push my opinions on you , but i really do like the new film. I think the plot was well thought out and the art work is well done. So I am not hating the film , but rather I just want to ask : why did they make it like this ? Why are they making a film where there is no romance? Why aren't they making a movie that is all romance and no drama. Why does the director want to ruin the romance. How is this what a romance is?

I'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it's absolutely everything you could ever want in a horror film. This is the definition of being a horror film. I consider myself to be a big horror fan and I must say that this house delivers the goods. House of wax Is the story of a group of college kids on their way to a football game whom decide to camp out for the night and have a run in with a local weirdo. Upon waking the next morning they make a gruesome discovery and decide to go into town for a broken car part.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful place at the apex of horror film production. This time, though, the Italian director decided to branch out. After two of his films were pulled from release due to legal issues, Lucio decided to get back to the basics with a new movie about his favorite horror genre, which isn’t even his best-known work. “What I’ve done in this movie is take the classic elements of the zombie film, but go one level deeper,” explained Fulci.

Being American , I have not been exposed to this character before , which is good because some of you Americans who live in England or Australia might not like this one. But if this character is not bad, what is it , who are they and what does he do. I have seen a lot of this character in American television. He was played by Tom Sizemore , he was in American TV series such as Law & Order series and Criminal Minds. I was not able to identify him in those shows because they were not American series .

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce , Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman 's remote home to offer her advice and support in an effort to keep the woman from moving in with her. After a few minutes of talking, Kate feels that she has learned a lot about her sister from the visit. However, before she leaves, Susan shows her how much she still cares for her. As they are packing to return to Sydney, Kate tries to get Susan to tell her why she's moving out of Sydney.

I wasn't expecting a great deal from this film, so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it and found it to be most noteworthy. It's noteworthiness is mainly due to the talent and appeal of it's star, John Garfield.Garfield plays Jack, a boxing star who is framed for murder. He must go on the run, and ends up out in the sticks with Gloria Dickson and the Dead End Kids. Here is offered a chance for redemption, yet will the past catch up with him yet? Garfield was an actor ahead of his peers.

It took me a while to find this movie since they don't have it yet on DVD (and my VCR is not worth hooking up again). I guess all the referencing to drug use is too much for some folks. But I found a decent bootleg on Ebay and I must say that anyone who takes this movie too seriously is just retarded. It is a slap stick spoof in the vein of "Airplane." I must say that when I watched it on Showtime or Spotlight growing up in the 80s, I enjoyed the humor a whole lot more then, than I do now.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way this movie turned out. Although it lacks in the big special effects department and there are no battles with hundreds of extras, there is still a masterful amalgamation of two old folk tales here. The acting talent, although not A-list, is still great and the interaction between the characters is perhaps more sincere than in a larger movie with an A-list cast. My particular favourite from this movie is Bridget Fonda, whose performance as the Snow Queen herself was quite moving, assisted enormously by a stupendous wardrobe and makeup.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly (1936-1959) is a tour de force for Gary Busey. The movie's highlights are Busey's stage performances where he plays guitar and sings Holly songs. He brings such energy to the performances that Holly's own filmed performances almost pale in comparison. Busey's infectious toothy grin lights up the screen, he creates a totally believable and winning personality and his Oscar nomination for best actor was well deserved.The film follows Holly's career from growing up in Lubbock, Texas, to stardom and New York and his untimely death in a plane crash.

I Loved this movie. Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role. More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade to this comedy level, which is at the very top of the line in my opinion. A no drink movie, you laugh so hard you will spill it all over yourself. Can We expect more? Let's hope so. I would like to suggest many movies for this type of remake. Mel Brookes made some remakes of classic films.He made some very strong contributions. A Picture of Dorian Gray would be a good suggestion.

This is one of Chaplin 's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more popular First National comedies. Chaplin, a man who had an incredible ability to adapt his style to different types of film-makers, was a great director who made some great film-noir comedies and some very good films about people trying to get by in a bad world. Chaplin is best known these days for his very popular comedy shorts, but before he became a star, he was quite famous for other things - including a lot of films about poverty which were quite successful at the time.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but he doesn’t overstep it as far as taking too much time with it. What is most impressive is the amount of footage that has been used. He is doing a great job of balancing the story without taking anything too serious from it. What was your first reaction when you heard that you were being asked to make an adaptation of an original story? I’ve always been a big fantasy fan and I was really looking forward to this.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a club with their girlfriend can go there with her, even though they're not married to her." "And it's not like that's a bad thing?" "Yeah, that's the problem." "You see, I've been thinking about this for a very long time." "It's one thing to do a show." "I mean, it's another thing to do that show in a place where everyone knows it's happening."

I had heard of John Garfield , but , did n't know him . I loved this movie . I love the movie , I am sure , you will , too . It tells the story of , Garfield the Great . I saw this movie over a decade ago . It was one of the biggest box office hits of 2001 . I saw this movie with my daughter , who was 2 . I remember seeing , in theaters , one of his last movies . She remembers seeing it , too , on the theater TV . She has seen it , and it was very good .

Do you liked "Dead Man don't wear Plaid"? What about "Top Secret" and "A Chorus Line"? Well Müllers Büro is a fantastic Melange of all three of them, as unlikely it may seem. Very Funny "tongue in Cheek" Movie Noir hommage with stunning Songs and great Dancing. You have to have a little odd humor for this movie, but it is very well worth seeing it. I've voted it a nine, If the end would be a bit more logic it would have gotten a ten. Thats how Good that Movie is.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency. Putney Swope is on the board for no other reason than the fact that he is black, and the agency needs a "token" on the board. Swope is ignoring the meeting, reading Jet magazine at the big table, and everybody is ignoring Swope... Suddenly, the CEO croaks on the spot. No time is wasted. A janitor is called to haul off the corpse, and the board immediately and unceremoniously tackles the business of electing a new CEO.

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since it makes you feel more connected to it . It is a very well done movie that keeps the interest of the viewer. If you enjoy this type of movies , I strongly recommend you give this a watch . This movie starts off with an action scene and we see a lot of blood and blood splatter. The movie has a lot of blood , which I like , but I also think that it is very well used . The acting is also very good and well done .

This is one of my favourite Disney films . It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation film . It is not a cheap film . It's not overly complicated .It's a very good animation film . I love it ! You can find the complete film on iTunes . It is available on Netflix for $11.99 and on many of your favourite platforms for $11.99 as part of a download. You can also buy it as an IMAX Blu-Ray for just $14.99 ! Here's the review :

I love this film !

Jack , Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond . His traumatic past experience has given him the ability to live off the grid. But as Sawyer tries to make his way to the island he finds out that he's being hunted by a man who will kill him if found. Sawyer's plan is to use Desmond as bait in the water to draw his prey to him. Sawyer finds Desmond's raft and gets ready to take him ashore but finds that there are too many sharks around and that the raft is floating dead in the water .

I thought Besson 's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them. The characters speak and speak to us without the usual dialogue. We hear a lot. In the end, they say almost nothing. It's as if you can hear what they've said and not want to, because they have no idea. The film works on three levels. It wants to tell us what we expect to hear from them. We hear about them and we believe them. But we also have to hear them, because we're watching them.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it . I found the film to be one of a kind in so many ways: it was funny, intelligent, insightful, original, poignant, beautiful, inspiring, and so much more . I thought the message in that movie was a bit lost, in fact it seemed like it was a bit lost for me. But then again, that's the way I like things. It was like I could not get enough of it and just loved every second of it.

I 'm not a massive Disney fan , but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them now. So I thought I'd share with you all some of the Disney movies that I'm obsessed with at the moment. This is just a round up of the Disney movies I've seen , and I'm sure there is more in the queue that I am yet to see. If any of you have a Disney movie that you've seen and loved then I want you to post it below, or leave a comment to let us know.

Blind Spot 's images are great . The action draws you in completely , even though the movie is a little slow . The plot is solid . A little too simple for some and too complicated for others . A very entertaining watch . There are enough laughs to make it worth while . But don't get too excited , there are also a large amount of horror and thriller elements , which make it feel like you are watching a horror movie at the same time . But if you're in for a good time, this is not the movie to waste your time on .

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indah'. It's not going to be an ordinary 'Hollywood action movie'. For one thing , it is set in the 1980's and early 1990's in Bali (Indonesia) and the title is derived from the 'Ali G Indah', which is the nickname given by the local people. There are lots of twists in 'Ali G Indah' but it won't be a 'moe action flick' but rather an exciting and entertaining action movie, full of twists and turns and a lot of action.

Can the intensity of a husband 's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime , despite her guilt or innocence ? There is a story which is not too well known about an Irishman who married his second wife, after living for some time with her in a secluded farm in County Clare. He loved his second wife in the first marriage so much that he took on the second wife as his second wife, and he spent every free moment of the day with her. But when he learned that she was pregnant, he began to have doubts.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings, who love film, have good attention to detail and enjoy indie movies with funny, smartly written dialogue then this is a film for you.For those with a poor attention span, high expectations and no brains.. well.. um.. you may get bored and find things dragging at times.This is a charming, modest and well paced movie with the actors bestowing a real sense of depth and warmth to their roles. I chuckled to myself pretty much the whole way through..This film is a little gem.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on this planet. Being a staggering five years in the making, one would be hard-pressed to expect any less. I did get the impression that some scenes from the first episode where repeated in the latter ones, which is naturally only a minor gripe.David Attenborough is great as a narrator and comments are informative, leaving enough room for one's imagination, and well spaced out, so that viewers get plenty of time to reflect upon the breathtaking imagery.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing? Never heard of them!! But this is one of the funniest comedies I have run across. It should win the Putz Puller Prize for Parody. The absurd starts with Dr. Jeykl snorting his powder and turning into a sex fiend.He is pursued by libido driven nurse early in the movie in one of the funniest scenes of the movie. Pay attention to the hospital PA system in the background; rather like the system in MASH. The final scene with Hyde accepting the award has had me laughing for years.

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I 'm dying to know how it is! I remember watching this movie in high school and it still had the power to get me on the edge of my seat. I had a lot of trouble sleeping at night from this movie, even after I realized it was a horror movie, so my dad bought me a VHS copy. I never watched it during the first viewing and it is definitely not one of my favorite movies or TV shows, but I loved it when I saw this movie again.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME. The 1973 musical remake of the James Hilton novel about mythical SHANGRI-LA! is a real special gem. Music by BURT BACHARACH and lyrics by HAL David. A strange mixture of straight drama, adventure and musical sequences. It has the distinction of being the ONLY anti war musical fantasy ever filmed. This film was a critical and financial disappointment in the United States, but made a lot of money overseas. Only in America did it fail.

I thought this movie was pretty good ! OK , so maybe it had a few scenes that could make it better than this , and I didn't like many of the plot points (I'm really not a fan of this series, but I'm a sucker for an action/adventure movie). That's all i can say really, I think the film is good, and the story is good, and this is a good story to get people's attention, I just wish it was much better. __________________I'm not an evil genius.

As with so many modern US films, there has to be a supernatural element to the plot, but if you just let that go, this is a tale with heaps of charm and a kindly heart cased in a crab shell.We are presented with a scene of a town in an economically depressed area struggling to find anything to be happy about. Beau Bridges' character is really up against it with a family on the increase, a nil bank balance and a brother-in-law who's sold out to a big business chain which he secretly hates, but in which he is willing to rub Beau's nose.

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing what my husband would be doing. We all laughed as I described it. He is a great lover and knows that I am the one. I am not ashamed to admit this ... My husband has taken me to bed as he has said in the past. We have made love a hundred times and I am not ashamed to say I have never been happier. He was wrong this time ... But not wrong enough to make an apology.

I always liked this movie, I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it :) the story is interesting and special. But the only thing I have to disagree with is that I don't think Max lived in a Romanian monastery or what was that :P They don't look that way in Romania.. Anyway, back to the story, Ghita Muresan played pretty well but as someone said before me, his English needs to improve. And there were some funny moments and some tragical/sad parts too. It worths being seen, I thought it was sweet that the giant wanted to find his love.

Films belonging to the `` film noir '' genre usually contain similar elements : a `` deus ex machina '' story in which an old and respectable man ( usually a former high-society dandy) takes a vacation to the countryside in order to escape the pressures of modern life. However, the protagonist is often a woman ( often a femme fatale) and the story is told in the first person in order to present the experience of the woman as the most interesting part of the film. It can thus be considered as an example of `` woman film.''

Just to see Chucky and Tiffany bicker and fight each other.

SPOILERS BELOW`A Dog's Life' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing. In Charlie Chaplin's other movie from 1918, `Shoulder Arms', the silent film genius focuses on an entirely different brand of humor. His war comedy specializes in surreal, exaggerated set pieces in which Chaplin demonstrates unprecedented creativity and mastery of composition. When the soldier's bunker gets flooded, the water level reaches just the right height so that Chaplin can execute his gags most successfully. In a later scene, the soldier dresses up as a tree, a disguise that belies Chaplin's much increased ingenuity and goofiness.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful reputation as the "Godfather Of Gore". Fulci's absolute greatest film, however, dates back to 1972 and, while it is definitely gritty and violent, it is not nearly as gory as many of his other films. "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" aka. "Don't Torture A Duckling" of 1972 is not only by far Fulci's greatest film, this tantalizing and utterly brilliant Giallo is one of the absolute highlights of the genre.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you'll be hard-pressed. HEAD is a masterpiece of non-linear non-structure, surrealism and experimentaion. In less than 90 minutes, it manages to be not only a time-capsule of an era, but also a full-length experimental feature that defies time,space and convention in a way that only underground films of the sixties could.HEAD is a reflection of those films. No matter how one feels about the Monkees, this is a film every filmmaker should see because it cracks wide open the endless possibilities of film as an art medium.

There 's no point in comparing this with the original series . Though different in look and content , both series share similar themes and plot. The plot revolved around a man who was involved with a gang of people who wanted to bring back a dead person and make them famous. Though he didn't know that their plan has been foiled when he was captured and put in an isolation chamber. The man was able to escape when he used his powers to bring back the dead. It was this incident which led to the rest of the gang breaking out.

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne's "For The Flag" by the Czech master director Karel Zeman.Although the story is enacted in a rather understated late Victorian style, the visuals are a knockout. Zeman uses animation, graphics, painted sets, model animation combined with live action to create the atmosphere of Verne that the reader associates in his mind. The style resembles the steel engravings of Dore and Bennet and Riou that illustrated these stories with a healthy dose of Georges Melies added.Photographed in beautiful black and white the animation is of the highest order and not of a Saturday morning variety.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

I just saw this film and I recommend it . It has a very good plot , it holds your attention from the beginning, you can see what is going on from the very beginning. This is not a good film for children but adults can really enjoy it . The film starts with a very well written introduction which takes you through all the action and how the characters are related. The film also gives you some background details about the characters. You get to meet some of your favourite characters , you meet many of your friends .

OK, so this film may not have won any Oscars, but it is not a bad film. The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family 's journey from the Old World ( Italy ) to the New World ( North America ). The name means “Golden Door”, and the story of a family’s adventure to North America is written from the perspective of the son, who was the eldest son, while his brothers were all grown up. The book begins when the father and mother, who were originally from the old world, are in the city of Naples and they are trying to find a job.

In Nordestina, a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco, Antônio (Gustavo Falcão) is the youngest son of his mother, who had uninterruptedly cried for five years. When he is a young man, he falls in love for Karina (Mariana Ximenes), a seventeen years old teenager that dreams to see the world and becomes an actress. Antônio promises Karina to bring the world to Nordestina, and once in Rio de Janeiro, he participates of a sensationalist television show and promises to travel to the fifty years ahead in the future or die for love with a deadly machine he had invented.

"Caribe" is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects. However, it delivers a perfectly enjoyable story, along with a magnificent cinematography. The narrative structure is set around two narrative axes, one of them embedding the other, each one having elements that relate and co-exist in excellent harmony. The story never loses the right pacing, and it shows a very good blending of the human figure with its natural environment (which is a character in itself). The acting is great, and for that we owe credit to the emerging director, Esteban Ramírez.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an `` against the system '' type of movie and the title being a parody, the movie is really a great satire of the way society operates. The character that I find to be the funniest are the one's who try to break society.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music . Filmmakers such as Roman Polanski, Robert Bresson, Ernst Lubitsch, Marcel Carné, Jean Renoir, Alfred Hitchcock, Alfred Hitchcock, George Cukor, Billy Wilder, Frank Borzage, Fritz Lang, George Stevens, Joseph Losey, John Sturges, Sergei Eisenstein and many more took the path to the stars. One of the great moments of this period, which came in 1967, was Jean Seberg’s first film, Vampyr.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci's reputation as a director. Too often he's categorized as a no-talented filmmaker, only out to shock and disgust entire audiences with images of pure gore. True, his films contain more explicit filth and sickness as your average mainstream American production, but his films always are of wide range and the plots are gruesomely morbid. Don't Torture a Duckling is yet another story! This film is a pure gem of the Italian shock cinema! I easily dare to call this film a masterpieceit's an old-fashioned giallo that includes all brilliant aspects of genuine horror.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something `` not human '' is portraying human beings and there's no question what happens to the human, which is what is being depicted in these animals. A cartoon is just another narrative, just as any movie or book is.

This film , winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 ( tied with P.T . Anderson for the Best Director Oscar) is based on Lee's experiences as an inmate in Guantanamo Bay. This story is based on the fact that he was released from Guantanamo in December 2005 after a trial that was conducted by the Bush Administration. He was released from an Iraqi prison after being tortured to the point of death, after being tortured for a year and a half, for providing information to the Iraqi Government about terrorists and drug smuggling.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread. Louis de Berniere's bestselling novel is one of my favourites and anyone who has read it will realise that there is no way in hell that any screen adaptation can be 100% faithful. All the way through I found myself convincing myself that the movie was unsuccessful, and had stripped the book's plot back so far as to render it redundant. The ending, however, is much better than that in the novel, and I could not stop thinking about the movie afterwards.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear of the “other.” La Spettatrice (La Spettere), a young Italian immigrant, is forced to flee Sicily to find a new home. La Spettatrice is determined to live in Italy so she can make her fortune, but instead finds herself caught in a nightmare from which she may never awaken. She finds herself on the run and on the end of a long knife. She begins her journey by taking her young nephew to Italy and then takes a train to Florence, Italy.

In Tweety's S.O.S, Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that happens to carry a certain canary bird-and Granny, his owner. Uh-Oh! Once again, Tweety and Granny provide many obstacles to the cat's attempts to get the bird. Sylvester also gets seasick quite a few times, too. And the second time the red-nosed feline goes to the place on the ship that has something that cures his ailments, Tweety replaces it with nitroglycerin. So now Sylvester can blow fire! I'll stop here and say this is another excellent cartoon directed by Friz Freling starring the popular cat-and-bird duo.

What's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season... Here is my forecast: 1. The hatch was indeed blown, but somehow everybody inside survived. Buts lets see about that. 2. The episode at the end with the tent is an observation team monitoring the tracking device installed on Desmonds boat by Penny. Now that the magnetic shield around the island was lifted, the signal was picked up by the observation station and they are going to send a rescue mission. 3.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews , and I had low expectations for this movie . I was under the impression that the only way people could get into this film was by reading some reviews and watching some trailers. The trailer and reviews seemed to show that everyone was into this movie . It was a surprise that I wasn't. It was actually a pretty bad trailer. I guess I wasn't in the target audience of the trailer . So I was very disappointed to find that a good portion of the public ( and the majority of the movie reviewers ) seemed to be into this film .

The film is n't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch . The cast does an awesome job and the editing is done well. However, it isn't without some flaws. For starters the acting is uneven at times and there are just some lines that get lost in translation. Also, the script is a little bit confusing and confusing at times as well. As a result, the film doesn't hold your attention for long and the story is a little slow to kick in. There were a lot of minor mistakes on the editing side too.

I never thought I 'd say this about a biopic , but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (for better or for worse) going on right now. I'm not talking about what the director did with the script, which could be done at any moment. I'm referring to just how the biopic gets down to brass tacks. This is about how it's made, about how everything else is managed, and about how this biopic plays with the audience's expectations. I want to give a few thoughts that I've noticed, which are going to be the topics of this piece.

I loved this film , which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival . In March 2005 I wrote an article for the New York magazine called " The End Of The Tourist " about the film which is now in its second screening in Philadelphia , at the end of May . The story is quite familiar , it just takes on a more urgent urgency with each subsequent screening . But this time , as the title suggests , I am not interested in tourism ; rather , what we are really interested in , and what is on our minds these days , is our survival .

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character . The humour comes out in all directions. Sometimes it's just an oddity, sometimes there's more to it but often it's funny to look at the character in his own environment. It's great to see a show that doesn't rely too heavily on big jokes to get laughs out of it. That's something I think I have seen done too often in other series. It's a testament to how good the writing of the show is. The episode itself was pretty fantastic.

"Hari om" is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name(played by the wedding planner from Monsoon Wedding) greets you and takes you on a journey through the heart of southern India. There's no "Bend it like Beckham" backdrops and stereotypes, and only slight salutes to the music and dancing of Bollywood (however, the soundtrack is well worth procuring), but rather, the feel that you are seeing the real India permeates the film through the use of dozens of local residents in each scene to augment the performance of the five professional actors.

Wow , What a wonderful film-making ! Mr. Im has done it , again ! His last work , ChunHayang, is so excellent , but this movie has it’s own special charm. If you want to learn more, I recommend to watch it on YouTube by clicking on the following link:

I hope to see Mr. Im in my country soon , so we may get to watch him again , as I have a feeling , that he is going to have one of his best performances in his next film . Stay tuned .

(Some spoilers included:)Although, many commentators have called this film surreal, the term fits poorly here. To quote from Encyclopedia Britannica's, surreal means:"Fantastic or incongruous imagery": One needn't explain to the unimaginative how many ways a plucky ten-year-old boy at large and seeking his fortune in the driver's seat of a red Mustang could be fantastic: those curious might read James Kincaid; but if you asked said lad how he were incongruous behind the wheel of a sports car, he'd surely protest, "NO way!"

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best yet. And it's about time. After all, THE TROUBLE WITH TIBBLES episode was such a good thing. I don't think I've ever seen a television episode that I did like better than this one. I know people who feel the same way. I know people who can't stand it either, so you'd think they'd find THE BALANCE OF TERROR the best yet. And it's true, they can't stand it. But so can I.

Ross Hunter's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy, based on James Hilton's enduring bestseller, was written off by critics and audiences almost immediately in 1973, sounding off a backlash against musicals in general that gave the genre a bad reputation in Hollywood for years. Group of disparate British and American individuals end up on an emergency flight out of a war-torn Asian country, but their plane is hijacked and crashes in a snowy mountain terrain; a rescue party arrives and leads the group to an isolated community called Shangri-La, where the sun is always shining and most of the residents are youthful and blissfully content.

where do we go from here? that is the overriding question of this film. And make no mistake, 'mainly ETC. ', the 2003 effort from director john jansen, asks far more questions than it answers, but none so poignantly or so powerfully as this one.much of the the film plays like a running conversation between you and your college drinking buddies, and I'm sure many of the questions raised by the main characters you'll recognize from your own evenings of drunken debauchery. however, one of the many beauties of this film is that we are rarely given an answer.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie. It follows all the rules. Short scenes, to the point, cheap to shoot, guerilla-film-making, no sets (just disused buildings) and possibly an empty hospital wing. Also, even the black&white film-stock was a stroke of genius, probably selected more for its low expense rather than film effect, but it worked.Reno was amazing as the Brute. Everyone's acting was brilliant. The plot was simple and effective and no flabby bits left to distract you.

My impression , having seen this documentary , is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had answers for. The questions that were asked of him by those who had to be questioned were very obvious, as well as the answers he gave, and this is something you would expect to see from a professional interrogator. Instead, he found himself in a rather odd position, with some people who wanted to know the truth of his involvement in this project, and others, who wanted to have a say in the project's future.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it. That would be fine if the film were a travelogue, but as a dramatic exercise in cinematic artistry, that is not good enough. The theme of inter-species respect and co-operation ventures timidly into the forbidden world of inter-species love, but its approach is stereotypical, indicating a lack of understanding of the behavior motives of either species. As with many films, one always wonders what could have been achieved by a more innovative director and a more creative screenwriter. Alas, we probably will never know.

One of the most magnificent movies ever made. The acting of Charles Buchinski (later known as Bronson) is simply outstanding. This is the crown on the career of director Winner, who himself was often quoted saying this was his masterpiece. The plot has been copied many times, but it's never been topped. Wildey J. Moore, the gun manufacturer, many times claimed his brand's growth since the mid 80s can be fully credited to DW3, and rightly so. This is not just a movie, this is art that many generations will admire and appreciate.

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally, at the end of the 1960's decade. It was immensely entertaining, and provided a contemporary view of the many changes which had occurred during that period - and were still ongoing - in terms of the Black Power movement, Vietnam, and the volatile movement which followed the quieter, preceding postwar 1950's.All of this and one of the funniest films, then or now.Viewing it for the second time recently, I was surprised to find it as engrossing as when seen originally.

A labor of love . Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you . Then the sheer emotion and story-telling are just right after the picture . I am so impressed that you captured all those details so well . You really are a master at this! Thank you for this beautiful work and I am so happy to see more of your work! I’m so glad someone else enjoyed it as much as I did. I hope you are able to get more done with this one . Keep up the great work and please do not ever forget to tell us how much you appreciate our comments!

When I first saw this movie,I also expected "our boys" to be cute,and more like an extended version of the TV show. I didn't "get it" back then. But,years later,at a party YEARS later,at a 70s' type PAR-TAY,where certain substances had been smoked,inhaled,and with plenty of tequila,"HEAD" was on late at night.We watched it,and finally realized what "HEAD" was all about. It spoofed their own show,as shown in one song that called themselves,"a manufactured image".

Is this a good movie? It's hard to say -- but in 1953, for many people, it was a remarkably effective movie, suspenseful, scary and then, amazingly, actually touching when "the old gentleman" meets his unhappy death at the end of the movie.Yes, what lurks in the Maze turns out to be something of a surprise and, for a lot of people, a hilarious one. But the basic idea (ontogeny recapitulates phylogeny) was a very real one at the time the book was written, and does have some basis in fact.

It 's just that . Chucky 1 was good . Chucky 2 was better . Chucky 3 sucked . Now we know why we're in this mess . Lets just see how far we get . As for the story, I think the first and most important question that everyone must answer is "Why?". It's not because he's "evil" and "not human" or "bad" and "good" and "human".

I do n't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch but couldn't see anything. Is it available on DVD? What are some good places to get it and how much is it? I was able to get a copy but I didn't realize that the DVD was part of the movie.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live . I know personally most of it's story, but some of it will sound like fiction. The story starts in 1980, in a small rural community in Eastern Ontario, Canada. There is an elderly man, living alone. His wife died many years ago, and his grandson, a young man about the same age as yourself, came to see him to ask for some help. The elderly man says he is happy he has a grandson, but he is also concerned for the young man.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars (The Monkees and Victor Mature), or its director/co-writer (Bob Rafelson), but also its other co-writer (and brief cameo) Jack Nicholson. As it stands, most of them seem to shun it, and to outsiders the movie is regarded, at best, as a curio.While the T.V. series was famously based on the antics of the Beatles' 'Help! ', this film is also judged by the same accord. Yet far from the trite and painfully overrated Beatles films, and even the dated Monkees T.V.

I was watching an NFL game and started surfing during a break and found this on one of the HBO sites and was amazed at the level of quality. I know some people are not big football fans but there is a lot to be said for this site. The site gives you a different perspective on NFL games and I love that you can see a game in a different light. This site is worth checking out. I don’t watch any other sports. I enjoy some football and basketball but not at the level the NBA or NFL plays.

My impression, having seen this documentary, is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had before he made the film. He took five years to make it, a labour of love and longing. I can only imagine the turmoil of the editing process, what to leave in, what to take out. His father, the renowned architect Louis Kahn,comes across as a man too selfish and self-absorbed to be emotionally available to even one wife not alone three. But like many men of his character, he attracted women who were spellbound by the remoteness and entranced by the creativity.

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful story of a man and a woman hungry for something more in their lives than they have at present. The chemistry between Lane and Gere is magical from the first scene in the film to their last embrace. The locations, beauty of their attraction for one another when it unfolds when they first meet, and the story that follows, and as they begin to know each other with the attraction they feel towards each other is real, is romance that is projected to an audience with tender care.

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I've seen in a while. It's an emotional roller-coaster. One of my favorite scenes is the pub scene. When Dirk tells Grace that he didn't want to go to the pub because the villagers don't like him, you expect the worst. When the old woman holds her glass up and says 'To the Memory of Victor Fox and the whole pub follows suit, I wanted to cry. The funeral scene is hysterical! Julie does it in her typical Julie Andrews style. Johnathan Pryce is excellent as Victor.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen: much better and deeper than Luhrman's Romeo&Juliet or Spielberg's Titanic. Gerda's love impresses me every time, her search, her battle is exceptional. Gerda becomes a strong, loving woman throughout the movie. Kay is the poisoner of dark forces: the temptation. This story encourages me to fight like Gerda for the ONLY ONE, for the love of my life, for Mister Right. Patience is one of the keywords of this movie. I cry every time when I realize all the suffering of Gerda and Kay.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos. A talented actor and musician, he has starred in many movies and TV series as the lead, supporting or cameo role. He was also nominated for an Emmy in 2003 for his performance in the TV movie, "The Life of Riley". In 2003 he was one of the lead players in the movie "Romeo and Juliet", which won an Oscar for Best Foreign Film. In 1997, he was a guest in one episode of the American soap opera, Days of Our Lives.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates "Separate Lies," a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson, Linda Bassett and Rupert Everett. Directed by Julian Fellowes, it's the story of a married couple, James and Ann Manning where the husband (Wilkinson) believes he and his wife (Watson) are happy together. An accident near their house on the night they have a party brings the police around. It is a hit and run that killed their maid Maggie's Bassett) husband. James becomes suspicious of a neighbor, Bill Bule (Everett) when he sees some damage on his car.

Wow, What a wonderful film-making! Mr. Im has done it, again!His last work, ChunHayang (2000) was a great film, but this one is even greater. Selected as an official feature film in the Canne Festival for the second time in a two-year row, this 66 years old director is getting better and better at what he is making of with a Korean culture.Simply, Chihwaseon is about a great Korean painter, '(Ohwon) JANG, Seung-Up' who was considered as a prodigy in the late Nineteenth century.

This is one of Chaplin's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more mature United Artists features. More opulent than the Mutual films, it continues Chaplin's quest for perfecting his comic expression. Most people forget that the film is actually a dream that Charlie has while awaiting being sent off to the front.There is plenty of slapstick via the Limburger cheese being used to gas the enemy, and Chaplin's foray into enemy territory dressed as a tree.By this stage in this career, the great man had become so immersed in filmic expression that his films give the impression of making themselves.

I went to the pre-screening of `` Rory O'Shea Was Here . '' I like this movie better than I thought. But I still think I would watch it as a rental for the first week of its screening. I went to see it with friends and my wife and I saw it together. I think I will see it again. The film has a nice tone. I like the acting. It has great actors. And the chemistry between the actors is good. But in the end I thought the film was better as a rental.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts. But it will put you close to being in a time and place that no longer exist by getting to the *feeling*.As Keith Richards remarks in Paul McCartney's movie about Holly, there's some Buddy Holly in almost all rock made since his day. The tragedy that took him is dealt with gently, and the rest of the movie recreates the joy of a great music career and a joyful body of music.Gary Busey does a remarkable, energetic portrayal of Holly, and his performances hint that he really gets into the music.

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow. It accomplished this through the energetic performances of the leads, the steadiness of the camera-work (avoiding 'rock-video' clichés that were actually invented for the Beatles in their first two films), tight editing, and a non-judgmental presentation of the star as human being rather than symbol or god (or demon). Yes, there are minor holes in the plot, and incidental details that are a little unnecessary, and there will always be debate between families of those personally involved as to specifics.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

A great movie . The movie was even better then the commercials put on . And believe it or not the commercial is great . I would rate this movie at a 10/10 . It is a beautiful film . Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history , someone had to be the first person who has managed to put all the pieces together and have a successful movie about that situation. And that person has to be Steven Spielberg, who is a veteran of the Vietnam war, so he is familiar with the situation he's in, and is a brilliant director. I've always felt that a movie like Pearl Harbor, even if it was set in WWII, should have made a lot more money than it did.

I love this movie, though I don't like how they picture Egyptians, being an Egyptian citizen myself! that's why it earns an eight out of 10.The relationship between Augustin and the leopard is awkward, and of course because of loneliness and living in that cave for quite so long, he develops a kind of insanity and passion to that leopard.A very touching scene when the leopard dies, watch Augustin's reaction.. All in all I find it enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to reading the short story by Balzac.

I think it definitely is . The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should be able to get a sense of a writer that is well educated in the writing arts. There is a definite skill in the language that the writer has, which will be apparent throughout the writing. I have no doubt that if the writer had the benefit of years of experience he would make it clear as possible to the readers the kind of writing he has been involved in, and would have given his reader a great deal of amusement.

I just thought I would add another observation, here. While there are a couple of visual sub-references, in this episode, to the possibility of unexpressed feelings between Jim Kirk and Yeoman Janice Rand; there is a special, physically tender, moment, toward the end. When the Enterprise is reversing at emergency warp speed in an attempt to outrun a possibly fatal Romulan plasma ball, Janice, perhaps fearing that their life is about to come to a dramatic end, seeks comfort by placing her head on Jim's sympathetic shoulder as they observe the aproaching instrument of their impending doom on the main viewer.

So it's not an award winner, so what? Have you ever wanted to see a film that was just silly? "The Villain" and this one could top the list.My husband says that "Jekyll and Hyde Together Again" is one of those movies that if "you've been there and done that" you'll think this spoof on the 80's cocaine culture is a riot. I think the whole film is just fun. Nothing is sacred; hospitals, plastic surgery, Howard Hughes.... There are ongoing gags that you have to watch for to appreciate.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good. And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. The other two principals were "decent". Bill Bule, on the other hand, was an insufferable jerk who I was praying would meet an extremely brutal and prolonged demise. Who was I kidding? Tom Wilkinson isn't Paul Bettany after all.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20 Movies I've Seen in 2018. If there's one movie that deserves a rewatch, this is it. I still love it. 1. Inception



It was such a surprise that Inception opened to such overwhelming reviews - this was such a great movie to watch after watching such a mediocre movie from the 80s. It's just so great. It was just this incredible film that I can't believe nobody has seen it before. It's just the best.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004 's Academy Awards , My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to make a documentary film about the history of architecture in America, and to examine the role of architects in society. My Architect was made in 2004, and won best documentary feature. It also won the Golden Bear for best documentary feature at the 2004 Berlin International Film Festival
. The documentary also won best documentary award at the 2004 Golden Trailer Awards
, and in 2005, The film won best film at the Cannes Film Festival.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time. Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. Every time I watch it, I can get something else out of it. It's a real testament to wanting to hold onto a life that was good, but now the world is changing. But you don't have to be older to hold onto the past, even the young characters, like Charlotte don't want things to change. The overall tone and mood is excellent. The cast is outstanding with all-stars like Kathy Bates, Beau Bridges and Arthur Kennedy.

I have to offset all the terrible comments . I love this movie . I own the movie and the soundtrack as a soundtrack so I do feel like an idiot but i don’t understand the backlash. This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally , at the end of the 1960 's , but that doesn't mean that is a film that can be seen in this time. I was looking forward to it because the subject of it seemed to be so interesting. It was supposed to be on TV and to some, it was not the best film they had to offer, but it still was entertaining and well made. The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special "Simpson's Roasting On An Open Fire" which had basic drawings and not laugh out loud jokes, but this episode has probably the first laugh out loud joke in it and from here the show just gets better and better. This episode centers around Bart who in this episode swaps on a test from Martin and gets into a school for the highly gifted, this leading to Bart mending his friendship with his Dad and losing all of his mates. The Episode is very humorous and shows what was to become the greatest show ever to come out.

I just can't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense. It was never supposed to make sense. (Duh! The writers were completely wasted on Frodis at the time.) It was just supposed to entertain and mock, and it does both wonderfully.The Monkees are good actors. They wouldn't have been hired if they weren't good actors. Mike has a thing for deadpan and darkness, Micky is the best at sheer psychotic comedy, Davy is a Broadway veteran, and Peter actually had people believing he was that dumb in real life.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music. Filmmakers were daring to make avant-garde films discussing taboo subjects only permitted before in exploitation films. Starting with both "Breathless" and underground American cinema (such as Kenneth Anger), films became more and more experimental. All of this accumulated when Hollywood realized they had mass commercial appeal with "Easy Rider". One of the best (and most surprising) outputs of this era was also one of the least successful initially.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety , my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of art have this power to draw people to them as a whole and not just to any one specific scene. It is often hard for a film to capture its audience's attention and create a strong emotional response as well as engage the viewer intellectually . So in the end, for me it is not so much that this film is "bad", but rather it is a great piece of art, but one that is a bit of a downer in my mind.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. Always enjoyed "DOA",1950,which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film. Dennis Quaid,(Dexter Cornell), was a professor who loved his wife and finally found out she was having an affair with one of his students. Dexter gets involved with Meg Ryan(Sydney Fuller), who was a student in his college class and at the same time had a big crush on him and wound up having a one night stand and in some ways loved him deeply.
