1969 was the year. New York City was the place. Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film to achieve some recognition. The first was Chaffed Elbows (1966). Putney Swoope achieved a much wider release. Pound (1970) and Greasers Palace (1972) were even more profane and obnoxious. Those 2 films were mean spirited to the point that they actually stalled the Prince's feature film career for several years.The subject at hand is Putney Swoope. And it is a mad farce/satire that has to be seen to be believed. I'm not going to go through the plot here.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . As in the original, Kersey is a scientist and the main protagonist of the movie. However, Kersey is more than that in this movie . In fact, the character of Kersey is almost the whole reason that the film was made . In order to set the story straight and to give the audience an explanation of the events that are the background to this film , there is a large part of the movie that deals with the effects that the film itself had on the characters and events .

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to the same. There are parts in it that make me want to get up and walk off the damn screen, but then I see my wife's reaction and know she's laughing for real and I don't want that either, so I'm laughing too. What's funny is when I was reading about this movie the other day the guy who wrote the review was saying he was laughing so much that he was just about to give up.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father, Louis Kahn, dead since 1974. The film builds slowly, but perfectly, and what starts out as a seemingly lost fortysomething's identity crisis unfolds into a beautiful tale with much deeper meaning with regard to the importance of love, loss, family and perhaps more importantly, our life's work.I had never heard of Louis Kahn prior to this film, although I was vaguely familiar with some of his work.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 `` They Made Me a Criminal . '' It was an enjoyable film to behold, but it was never to be considered the best in the Garfield filmography. It is only a matter of months since the original print of the film, released in 1938, was destroyed, and only a couple years later the film was restored to its original version. For the next several years, this restoration has been done by the UCLA Film and Television Archive (UTAFFA), and this is the best one has yet been accomplished.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen. Clearly not that many because it only got a 6.8. There is nothing wrong with it at all. It's my favorite of the Disney classics, which have tons of fantastic films already made. Like Beauty and the Beast, Snow White, and Peter Pan. The reason why The Aristorcats is so high on my list is because of how funny the film is. I hate to say this, but I don't blame Edgar for what he does. I probably would've had them taken care of too.

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog's filmic work that is without peer. Having recently rewatched it on DVD, nearly a decade after its initial US release in 1997, it has lost none of its power, and one can see its influence on documentaries as diverse as Herzog's own recent Grizzly Man and Errol Morris's Academy Award winning The Fog Of War. Like the former, it details, in its far too brief 74 minutes, the life of an interesting American. Like the latter it gives a peek at a side of war that few see.

One of the most magnificent movies ever made . The acting of Charles Buchinski ( later known as Bronson ) is beyond anything Hollywood has ever seen . I could not watch it without wanting to tear out the entire first act , but in all honesty it is one of the most incredible films on earth . I’m giving it an 8/10 because it was such a powerful story and it was so well made . The soundtrack of it was also excellent . It is one of the few movies I really like to see live because it is so well told .

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall the movie is effective very effective it makes you question and leaves you thinking the story is kinda far fetched but is believable and makes you feel good in sequences, its not like its the usual done and tried path. the characters are pretty well defined and are convincing. Justin long stands out among all the others and watch out for his speech in the end he will convince anyone with that speech he is simply brilliant in that speech.

Always enjoyed `` DOA '' ,1950 , which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film . Dennis Hopper's performance as one of the robbers has always been the highlight for me in this film . I was surprised with the quality of the music that Hopper's character brings . I have to say that this is his best film to date . I'm not sure how well this will do if it does get an Oscar nomination ... but it's very good , if only because it is Hopper's best film . I don't think he'll win an Oscar this time .

"I am ... proud of 'Head'," Mike Nesmith has said. He should be, because this film, which either has been derided by many of us or studied and scrutinized by film professors, works on many levels.Yes, it's unconventional. To many, frustrating. It's almost as if the producers hand you the film and tempt: "You figure it out. "You probably already know that The Monkees TV show was a runaway marketing success that depended upon business acumen and no small serving of public deception. TV shows are about selling soap and toothpaste first, than to entertain.

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

This film is an impressionistic , poetic take on the immigrant experience , a reflective look at the turmoil and struggles faced by the American population when they find themselves in the United States. It is also a critique on what it takes for an immigrant to become fully integrated into the US society. I hope you enjoy this film ! As you know , I love movies. Movies are something I go to watch every weekend and it is something I am always interested in. I love to see how a movie makes people feel and what it means.

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the elements we like in the Columbo episodes. We get the laugh when Columbo makes something clumsy, and it happens more than once in Double Shock. I can almost guarantee that you will laugh several times if you decide to watch this episode.We also get the riddle as usual with an almost perfect murder, but something about the murder troubles Columbo. The end is the usual, we get the story about how Columbo solved the mystery.This is another good Columbo-episode, and I will rate it 7/10.

As far as I know I 've seen most of Lucio Fulci 's films , with the exception of some of his early ones , and there are some of my favourite parts of his early films . I have even seen a lot of his films , and I must say I can 't wait to see his latest movie . He is such a talented filmmaker , he should have more work , and I will be watching and reviewing his films . My first impression of his latest film is the same as my first impression of the previous ones , he makes me laugh a lot , and is full of his trademark humour .

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation on this topic, and also made a big difference in my decision on the decision I am making regarding this purchase. This video is a very short one of 5 or 6 mins , but it’s the most comprehensive I have seen , that gives an accurate explanation on what is going on , from the beginning of all the problems that have happened, and how we can all be part of a solution . I highly recommend this for all of you that are looking for help on this topic.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an Italian Officer and a Greek Villager in an honourable story: "Captain Correli´s Mandolin", just escapes me! Witness: a wobbly, inconsistent accent by Cage amid horrendous over-acting, with Cruz -- more adequately cast as a spoiled Latino opposite Johnny Depp in "Blow" -- in basically a repeat performance under the guise of a Greek nurse... ay, it was painful. But there were saving graces.The story itself is thrilling-to-tragic, and Cage does have some (-- redeeming, this is !--) musical ability.

That this film flopped at the box office , and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today , is a testament to the value of a film’s story , and it is the only film that can be made to work , and be seen by the average moviegoer today , because of the way the story was conceived , by the way the actors and the director acted and directed it , and the way the entire cast and the crew were brought together , and the way the script and the direction and the production values were made to work together . A film is a film .

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see . The acting , writing and production values were top notch . The cinematography , songs and soundtrack added up to the best film in my opinion , and the special effects were truly impressive . This is what made the movie to win many awards at the Oscars .The movie has been made available to the general public via the Netflix website , but I have to tell you it wasn’t quite perfect .It was quite disappointing that the Netflix release didn’t include the complete movie .

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been a huge shame if the show had to do all that cooking ). But it was really a variety show and in a good show like this you have a couple of guests. I don't really think you have to have an audience. I'm sure you had a great audience, there's just too many people to talk to. The only show in the country I really watch and I really liked it. Good to see that the weather's finally cooling down.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I'm Dancing'... i didn't know a thing about it, so had no preconceptions before i went in.The film is about two guys who are confined to their wheel chairs, and live in a home. Michael (Steven Robertson) suffers from Cerabal Palsy and Rory (James McAvoy) suffers from Muscular Dystrophy (please excuse any spelling mistakes!). They form a bond, as Rory seems to be the only person who can understand what Michael is saying.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast! After seeing sneak peaks for BOOGEYMAN (Horrible! 3/10) and Amityville Remake (so-so 6/10) I enjoyed this a lot more! As seen in the trailer, one knock I had was believing that a whole town could be "forgotten" but this is a cheesy popcorn horror movie so I accept it for what it is.My only major complaint is I assumed Paris Hilton would touch wax or get dipped etc. and moan "that's hot" but they didn't do that (how could they resist???

The revelation here is Lana Turner's dancing ability. Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub and ballroom dancer, Miss Turner rarely got the opportunity to demonstrate this ability on film.So, viewers take notice! Here, MGM were clearly still trying to determine in what direction they would develop the still young starlet, and were, therefore, consigning her to everything from Andy Hardy to Doctor Kildaire.In "Two Girls on Broadway," however, she is given an excellent opportunity to display her native rhythm and ability to shift tempo in the lavish production number, "My Wonderful One, Let's Dance."

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once , about ten years ago . It’s not in the book . I got the idea after reading the book . I have read books by Verne before so I thought it’d be fun to make my own . It was a good choice . I don’t care about the movie much . It has nothing to do with the book so I’ll skip the film . My sister’s a big fan of this movie . I love all the action sequences in the book so I think they fit the movie quite nicely .

The "old dark house" sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the oldies to-day. Here is one that provides so very many suspicious characters you have to wonder how they will be able to tie up all the loose ends in the 6 reel running time.The Crooked Circle is a gang of counterfeiters and thieves who have decided to take revenge on Col. Walters (Berton Churchill) who has sent one of their ranks to prison. They decide he must die that very night. Meanwhile the Colonel's own group, The Sphinx Club, is determined to protect him at all costs.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n ' roll . The young singer/songwriter had a career that reached its apex in the early 1960’s. Holly began his career by playing piano in his church in Los Angeles, California. He moved on to other local bands, performing in rock clubs, and touring the country, until he finally settled down to writing and recording songs. On the surface, it’s hard to imagine the beginning of the ‘60s rock scene without the man known as Buddy Holly.

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local elections, nasty chancellor David Carlton (Charles Dance) hopes to discredit his party's current leader, thus enabling him to seize power. To his surprise, however, the plan backfires, Ali is embraced by the nation, and Carlton is forced to find other ways to try and guarantee his political future.Puerile, crude, misogynistic, and always outrageous: Ali G Indahouse, the big-screen debut outing for Sascha Baron Cohen's middle-class Berkshire gangsta, is all of these things and much moremeaning it's my kind of film!

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good . And of course by that I mean Wilkinson is not annoying but he is the main character . Just a few things that stood out about the film , which were things I had not realized about the movie. The main thing for me is the story and the main characters. This film had so much potential but could not deliver in my opinion . 1. The main characters. I really liked this film , the characters are great and I love the storyline. I would like to see more action .

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne 's `` For The Flag '' by the Czech master director Karel Kral, which was presented by a very special private collector to his son Jan Kral Kral. In this remarkable film, which was a real gift from a young Czech collector, Kral uses all of his skills in his film making. Kral shot the film in a very high quality color film, and this film is truly unique and amazing to look at. Kral is a truly talented film maker, who has created many of his works with his own unique style, which is worth seeing.

The "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." scene was a riot. I also guffawed at the scene in the bar where Hyde snorted the horse radish and flipped the bird to the Japanese guy and said "Pearl Harbor buddy". I think my IQ is higher than 115, but I'm not sure because I can't count that high.Funny thing, this 10 line requirement. Seems as though they would bash you for making your comments too long, not too short. I hope I don't make it to 1,000 words before I get to line 10.I'm still two lines short.

This is one of my favourite Disney films. It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation: cute animals, great songs, a nasty villain and lots of adventure. The story begins in Paris, where aristocat Duchess and her three kittens live with their Mistress in a mansion. Life is perfect for them until the Mistress' fiendish butler Edgar discovers that she plans to leave her entire fortune to the cats. He realises that if he even stands a chance of claiming the fortune, the cats will be out of the way.

I loved this film ! ! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it for real ! It was an amazing film , and the acting was on point . This is a film which I have watched several times in my life but never in depth .I am not going to say too much about this but I just wanted to express my thoughts and feelings about this film . I love it !! ! I love the characters , the story , the acting , the story line . This is one film that I will always remember !

I will admit, I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film, and after about 5 - 10 minutes into it, I felt like many did. I was expecting a Monkey movie that was similar to the television show, but instead I was given... well, I didn't know what I was given to be honest.However, after finally watching this film, I realized that not only had I had a closed mind to the brilliance it depicts, I also found myself watching it over and over again.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form. I tracked it down on video a couple of years ago and viewed it again. The film although slow and slightly odd (the mountain men look very strange) the atmosphere was eerily effective. It's one of my favorite slasher films and I have no idea where an uncut version can be found. Currently deleted everywhere (except the USA where it was accidentally put on a horror compilation!). It's a shame you cannot get this movie as it was meant to be seen.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius. And this movie is good! Although the film doesn't nearly reach the quality of the tv-show, it's still very funny and has some seriously wicked moments! I've liked Ali G since the first time I saw the material from the show. I think he's one of the best comedy characters of all time.. up there with say, Peter Dragon ("Action") and The Blues Brothers. Biggest surprise with this film was that they've actually got some serious actors to do it (Dance and Gambon).

Made at the height of the Black Power movement , this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope ( Arnold Johnson ) as a “New Black Power”, a self-proclaimed African-American leader who, during the “Great Society”, is the target of the racist Ku Klux Klan. But when he becomes a member of the White House White House Commission on African Affairs, which is charged by President Carter’s new black administration with creating an African-American cultural and political agenda, Swope becomes the first black president. As Swope’s presidency progresses to national prominence, Black Power and white racist politics come into conflict.

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war . Everything about the movie was perfect . If I were a man, there was no way I would have not made it. But I am not a man. I am only a woman, and I have to say, the way the story was told, was one of my favorite movies . The characters are so real. I am not exaggerating the love and the story. You would love it if you saw the movie. In the end of the movie there was a song, but I do not know what song it is.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies. Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 reminds me of "West Side Story" with a new twist. Not even the recent flick "Gangs of New York" can measure up with one New York neighborhood in Death Wish 3 which is plagued not by two rival gangs---but one big gang. A gang that is willing to do things like cutting a person to death with an ax if he trespasses on its set.Deborah Raffin, who plays a public defender, plays gently in this action-packed movie that is filled with a lot of shoot-em-up violence.

This film , like much of their music , is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer . It doesn't matter , it's so bad . I would watch this again , but there are better films to do that. It has the makings of a great horror movie . I'm not sure if it's going to succeed or just be a cheap cheap low budget film that I won't be interested enough to see again . I can't believe that these people are still in business . Why would they do it ?

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC. I've been looking for it ever since. It was haunting: visual, textural, sensual. This movie took me somewhere like a dream and I didn't care where. I will never forget the curtain blowing in the breeze. I still remember the way it made me tilt my head. I remember my facial expression when I saw it. I didn't know what had happened when the movie was over, but I find life is that way. It didn't bother me.

probably the best horror movie in 5 years.. there's been lame remakes, attempts to make you scared (when all they make you do is walk out of the theater) and movies that just shouldn't have been made. but this one is worth it. the only reason i didn't give it a 10 is because Paris Hilton is in it (but her death scene makes up for it, believe me)....so here they are.. the SPOILERS of all the death scenes in the movie..1. my favorite death scene ever - Paris Hilton's!

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series was coming to a close and the group was near break up. Their inventive and comedic series (sort of an American Idol of their day) took four unknown actors and formed a manufactured supergroup around them.This is their take on their "manufactured image" and status as the 2nd tier Beatles. They always felt they were in a box, trapped, and unable to find credibility despite their talents.It is also a hell of a musical-trippy, inventive (I have the soundtrack) and full of surprises.See it with an open mind.

"Don't Torture a Duckling" is one of the coolest Italian horror films I've ever seen, and I've seen my share. To call it a giallo is a little misleading because it's not really a typical murder mystery. It's more of a straight horror movie.Complete with one of the most brutal and gory scenes ever in a movie this old, Fulci's twisting and turning film oozes with a creepy ambiance and an old school Italian feel. The setting is perfect: an old Italian village. The music is ridiculously perfect.

NOBODY (1999) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir. It's about three salarymen who get in way over their heads when their innocent, drunken cheapshots p*** off three OTHER guys one night in a bar. When these three mysterious strangers, who are up to much more deviant no-goodness than even the film allows us to know, beat the living daylights out of one of our "heroes", the trio decides to return the favour in kind - only they accidentally KILL one of the other guys!

Oh my gosh!! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is so incredible......I loved it as a wee babe and still love it as an adult. It is my favorite Disney movie of allllllllllllllllllllllllllllll time! You should watch it, watch it and love it. My friends and I watch it a ton.....It is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good. I recommend it to anyone who is a child or a child at heart.

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens ö really do not do it justice. I read them all before ordering the DVD, but for some reason I ordered it anyway. I regretted it almost immediately, but the order had already gone through so I couldn't cancel it. I'm very glad now that I couldn't. It's an extraordinary movie.I won't give a synopsis of the plot, because other reviewers have already done that. But I will say that I don't understand comments that it's bleak, shocking, weird, clinical, depressing or pornographic.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old . I had no idea who Buddy Holly was (or that I would ever get to see him play), but I knew that I liked his music. I didn’t have any idea of any of the other musicians and bands he collaborated with or the impact his songs had on the music industry . I also didn’t care much about the politics of it all – I had no time for political music, and felt that I had an obligation to do my part in preserving the history of music we have today.

This movie is true action at its finest , It does n't get any better then this . This is a movie that you need to watch the entire time . The plot is well done , the acting is above reproach and the special effects are just awesome . I can not help but wonder what would have happened if all the characters on screen died ! I was impressed with what was going on and the acting was great . I'm not going into a review of the movie but I can say that this movie is a must see .

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce, Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman's remote country home and spend some time with her. When Kate arrives, however, Susan is nowhere in sight. That's because someone has murdered her and stuffed the body in a trunk in the basement. As a storm rages outside, Kate tries to figure out where her sister could have gone and places her own life in great danger...the killer is still on the premises! In her first post-BEWITCHED vehicle, Elizabeth Montgomery gives a solid dramatic performance.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something , and who appreciate a farce that is clever and entertaining...I want to add a few things.First, this has nothing to do with any dialog. It is just a movie and what you're seeing is exactly that. No one is trying to insult you, but I feel like this is not what a movie is supposed to be about. A movie is meant for entertainment, it's supposed to entertain. If it is supposed to be a drama, it should be about the drama.This is not my opinion of the dialog.

I ca n't get this flick off my brain . It 's definitely totally different than anything that 's out. I like it and I'm very excited for what they do next. I wish it was better, I wish they could have made it better, just like every other flick that came out in the past. I think a lot of people don't know what they're getting into and I can't blame them because it's really well put together. I just can't see this being done. It has to be done and I wish that it would be done.

This is a well directed Columbo episode , with also some good character but the story just does n't really work . i think there should be a lot more violence and drug use in this episode, but as always i'm a sucker for the violence and drugs . in the middle there was an interesting line that he had said , about his own death, which was just too bad , i felt . but other than this , the whole episode was really good . it was good , but not very interesting , with a lot of too many things going on .

"Showtime" is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro (Meet the Parents,A Bronx Tale) and Eddie Murphy (Shrek, Dr. Dolittle). The story is this: In the beginning of the movie detective Mitch (Robert DeNiro) and another detective go into a tv store trying to bust some criminals. When the cops arrive, Tray(Eddie Murphy)a cop, tries to arrest Mitch not knowing he's a cop. During this scene loads of funny things happen which catch the eye of tv producer Chase Ritz.

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but still it is fun and entertaining movie even if you have not watched this movie before I recommend watching it just for the storyline and some great action scenes in the second movie I hope you have time to watch these films

This is a good film, I love it! I saw it a few weeks back and really liked it. I recommend you give it a go. It will give you some great fun action. It was just an amazing movie!

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it. I found the storyline very distressing and can still remember the various bullying techniques used. One in particular was when the other school children spat in his soup before he could even taste a spoonful. They also bound him and shaved his private parts. This was all because he was unpopular. Why was he unpopular? Because he was bad at games. I have a feeling though that even if he was good at games he would have been bullied because it's hard to decide what makes someone popular.

Lucio Fulci 's `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by poverty and crime. One of the reasons is the lack of government action. But, in a society without laws, people are left with only two options. Either, they can take whatever they can get in the form of drugs or violence. Or they can use other methods, including physical torture, to force people to comply with their will. The movie ``The Drowning Pool'' does not shy away from depicting such methods.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've had an opinion on the man. In the last couple of years, and especially in the last year I have been more and more interested in him, his films , his style of writing, the people he has working with , and even the music he has been involved in. So when I saw this article from the LA Weekly , I decided I had to put it on here , and I am going to do so now !

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but still I enjoyed it. This time, Charles is not just fighting one or two muggers but a whole army of them. Death Wish 3 has a lot great action scenes and I enjoyed it every single second of it. Director Michael Winner knows how to direct a good action movie like this and Jimmy Page providing the music, with producers Golan and Globus still doing there thing and Charles Bronson is still acting good for Paul Kersey.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The film captures and interprets his artistic method ('sketching' poems), his inspiration (the spirit of nature and its fantastic beauty) and his struggles to accept a harsh reality in the face of his idealist imagination.The film integrated excerpts of Miyazawa's poems into the plot beautifully. His relationships with his students was powerful, especially in one scene where he offers everything he has to a student who has just been caught stealing materials from the classroom.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I 've just managed to watch this film for the second time this weekend. A couple of things strike me about the film:

I have watched this film so many times I think the second time is about as close to a "re-view" of the film as I'm likely to encounter in my lifetime. I had forgotten what the story was all about and I've seen this movie at least two dozen times before, so having a second viewing reminded me that I should never, ever, ever give up on anything I watch on the subject.

* May Contain Spoilers * The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was 8. I was very impressed with it because it had everything I was looking for, but it still had a few things that I didn't get to see much of. This is an important spoiler movie because it's one of those movies that is really long but doesn't have much story, so it doesn't have many twists, but it's still fun to go through the movie and see how it all ends.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White, Cinderella, or Bambi, but it IS a very sweet, enjoyable, romantic, well-done Disney animated feature.There are, of course, lessons included herein for the kiddies, and some very appropriate kiddie-cheek, but there is plenty herein for the adults, as well.While this is somewhat of a regurgitation of the Classic Disney RomCom Adventure, it still holds some elements, which solely belong to the AristoCats. O'Malley is the "tramp" and Dutchess is the "lady," but Dutchess has several kittens and they are all trying to get home.Phil Harris is our tomcat O'Malley.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining. It provides updates of tech news, video games pretty much everything geek. They are also the official broadcasters of E3 and Comiccon. If you are a geek, gamers or anything really, you will enjoy this show. They have definitely upped their game since the guy below me's review (2006). It's the only place that I get my tech info. Kevin Pereira and Olivia Munn work beautifully with each other and the show always has segments referring to things in the game, movie, comic... Universe.

This is a wonderful movie, and I still love it! It just so magical and it is fun for the whole family! I recommend it to people of all ages. I promise you will not be disappointed! The characters are always so engaging, so real, you will just love them! The story of Gerda and Kai falling in love will really amaze you and put that little spark of magic into your life.I don't see how anyone would care if the movie matched the book, I mean the movie was amazing! I haven't even read the book, and guess what?

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life, this time the creatures under the sea, in this extraordinary 8-episode trip to all the animals under the sea!The cinematography is astounding, bringing to the screen truly breathtaking footage of those whales! But the best thing about it, as well as seeing each episode, is how they made it! Whether it is making models of creatures, or those impressive shots of the whales, they explain to you in about 10 minutes how they did it!2001 had some great tv shows to our screen.

The movie does n't take itself seriously , and if you follow its lead you 're going to have a good time. "If you think you can make me cry, go ahead. All you need to know about the way I feel is that I'm scared. I'm a coward. Sometimes, I feel like an animal. I can't get my head out of the mud. All I see is pain in front of my eyes." -- "You've Been Around" by The Clash, from: "A Message From The Underground"

I love the Clash.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner's mansion in Paris. When the evil butler hears that the rich old lady is leaving everything in her will to the cats first, the butler is angered, because he wants to get everything first. So he puts them to sleep and abandons them off the side of the road. When the cats wake up, they start on a long trek home. A street wise cat named Thomas O'Malley meets up with them and offers to help them.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of "L'Anticristo"(1974),this one begins with a brilliantly-handled sequence involving a priest,a little girl,and a broken doll.However the main story is about maniac(David Warbeck)marrying a traumatized cripple to kill her for her money.The plot,whilst not original,is really suspenseful,the acting is good and there are several skillful and gory murders.The score by Francesco de Massi is quite effective,some of which can also be heard in Lucio Fulci's "The New York Ripper"(1982).Highly recommended for fans of Italian cinema!

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was . I was shocked as I thought it’s too long . I thought it would end in a good way with a good twist . But no , there’s a twist in the ending . But I loved the twist . The movie was so good . This movie has the potential to be a good movie . I have it on my watch list to watch this one . This movie has a good plot . This movie has a great action packed movie . This movie had good music .

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ( `` Three Minutes '' ) , the survivors were still debating whether or not to attempt another rescue attempt. If they tried to reach the boat they might miss their chances of being rescued. If they failed, they risked their own lives by swimming the river at high speeds and they risked being swept downstream to the shore. On the plus side , the crew did not need a rescue attempt, they were ready to go anyway. The survivors were not ready to give up in this episode.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback , and if anyone is confused about her past ( like I was ) - the whole thing is about Libby trying to get information from Desmond to help her father. I believe that Libby did not know that he was a drug dealer at the time. He was probably working for the CIA, but he was getting paid more. And in the episode where Desmond is with the cops and he has his gun, he tells Desmond that they are police officers and that they do things the same way as police officers do.

I absolutely adore this movie! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store. I saw Kathy Bates was in it, so I figured it had to have some worth, you know? I watched it the first time just shaking my head . . . huh? Then it was the last scene and I found myself aching from smiling so hard. I clicked "play movie" and watched the whole thing again. It is without doubt the quirkiest movie I've ever seen. But the more I watch it, the more I love it.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery 's best performances in a movie , and I have seen it many times before, so I can say with certainty that I will not miss a second of it! I love this character and I love the fact that she is not afraid to be who she is, no matter how difficult or uncomfortable it makes her life. I would recommend this film to everyone, including anyone who has watched the Twilight movies. I don't want anyone to think that it is out of order or that I am judging her character or something.

Mark Blankfield (from the old late night TV show "Fridays")plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll, a mild-mannered surgeon who invents a powder that turns him into a drug-crazed party animal. This was not, of course, his intent, he had higher aspirations, but he goes with the flow. This is actually a fairly stupid movie, but it's also pretty fun. Of course, once the good doctor realizes what he's done, he's ashamed, but he's also not above doing it all again & running through Hollywood as a crazed sex machine with frizzed out hair & gold chains.

This movie , based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt , is one of the best films I 've seen in a long time , so I felt like doing my bit to bring this great man out of obscurity by putting his name to the credits as the movie director. It was a very emotional experience to watch the movie from start to finish. You can tell he is so moved by this whole experience that you feel for him and you feel for those around him. His whole life, his whole story is etched on his face.

`` Caribe '' is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects . However , it delivers a perfectly enjoyable tale . With only a few notable exceptions . this is one of the best books to be written by any author in my opinion . And it's not as bad as the first chapter. It has some plot holes, but that is expected for a thriller, so it's forgivable . The book is narrated by a character , so the narrator is crucial , but there's really only one other person with which you can be compared . I love the plot .

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love , passion , and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss with a new documentary that chronicles his own personal and professional struggles over three decades . In his third feature since his film debut in 1996, Director Stephan Woloszczuk weaves together three very different stories to form a unique portrait of the life of a struggling artist who is forever changed in the crucibles of love , betrayal , and betrayal. For a man who has spent his entire life in the spotlight, Stephan Woloszczuk has had a unique experience in Hollywood .

Do you liked `` Dead Man do n't wear Plaid '' ? What about `` Top Secret '' and `` You're in my way '' ? If you don't think you can handle the lyrics to any of these songs, we've got you covered with a bunch of different songs in this pack, all based on the songs on the movie. So, get your friends, your boyfriends, your sisters or your moms together and download the songs below for free and put them on your iTunes, Spotify, Amazon or wherever.

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , and you may want to do yourself a favor and get a copy , the only reason I can think of that this film is so incredibly effective is due to the amazing cast . The film begins with the title card , followed by the opening of a swimming pool : " . . . and all that remains of a very beautiful duck . ". As the credits roll and we see the beautiful duck float in the water . . .

No , I have not seen the original series and I wo n't compare the two if I had . I don't think it's just the fact that everyone in the world has seen the original series or that they know how much the characters have changed . Like I said, the original series doesn't need to be a remake of the first one. I mean, maybe I have a point of view for the original that differs from the one that you have. But I think it's a bit too early for that.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans . Okay I 'm sure it 's not as good as the Chucky movies but this is a better movie then "Chucky 2". This movie starts out as the same thing as all those Chucky movies and then when you find out that Chucky is alive and well and has escaped, it becomes really interesting and you never really get a good ending to it like you have with "Chucky 2". The best thing about "Chucky" is that it does a good job at capturing the essence of the original Chucky, the bad guy from "Chucky 2".

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age in an airplane crash. He wasn't in the old rock 'n roll class of , let's say, Chuck Berry or Jerry Lee Lewis, but he wasn't far behind. Who knows how big his legacy would have been had he sang for decades. Almost every single he put out was a hit.So, I was very pleasantly surprised how good a job Gary Busey did at playing him and at imitating his singing voice.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? There were no lines, or characters. It’s like it never happened. It’s been out for like seven years already and the film’s been out for like two months. So that’s why I can’t tell you when it was actually made. I’ve been doing this for years and years and years. So I can’t give you a date or anything like that. So I’m not telling you.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews, and I had low expectations for this movie. I was pleasantly surprised. While the plot is a little off-beat, everybody in the making of this movie pulled off a pleasant flick good for many a laugh. The writing and jokes are far more literate than I have come to expect. Better yet, they are delivered with aplomb by unknown actors doing a good job, all of them.The main reasons I wanted to see this movie were Justin Long and Lewis Black. Long is from "Ed" and the new Apple computer ads.

This is sweet. The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira mistress of the dark. Another little tidbit is the actress who played the nurse who would give her wedding ring was the landlord lady of Roy Munsin in King Pin. This is most glorious story ever to be told. It should sell more copies than the bible. My parents played a part in suggesting the release of this movie to a local movie theater. The movie ran for a week and we were one of 4 families to see it.

In Nordestina , a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco , Antônio ( Gustavo Falcão ) is the sole survivor of an epidemic that left more than a dozen people dead. The disease had first struck Antônia in February , but by the time the villagers learned about it they were so sick they could no longer carry on with their lives. A doctor called to take a look at the disease says that the villagers didn’t even know they were infected, but Antônia had been lucky so far. In fact it hadn’t taken long for people to take notice of the symptoms of the infection.

Chucky 's back ... and it 's about time ! This time , with the help of Jennifer Tilly and the cast of Heroes, we have to wait a bit longer to see the first part of the film. We hope that we can see something of this strange creature , before the film comes back. We will be back for updates as the film progresses. Stay tuned for all the latest updates! G.I. Joe and the G.I.s have finally decided to make the jump from film to film, as it 's time. But this time around, they have to wait longer for the new G.I.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan, where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion. I really admired the story and visual approach. The action is frightening and the mood of loneliness that the film projects is amazing. There is much beauty in the melancholy that surrounds these three misfit heroes. Not just in the desert but in the city too. My best scene was after the boy discovers his friends in the apartment and then rides his skateboard through all the remarkable lights of the city. You really feel for this guy.

That 's right . Ohwon ( the painter and the main character ) is an exceptional person . What strikes one is his deep compassion . There is not a single scene where he is shown to be weak . This is the main reason he is chosen for this movie , he is so powerful . He is an incredible actor . The film starts with the flashback of the events leading to the destruction of planet earth . We see an old man talking to a young boy , he is telling him he wants to visit the moon . But as the old man talks he begins to cry.

This is a stunning movie. Raw and sublimely moving. It felt like a very gripping, intelligent stage play (but without the overly theatrical feeling one actually gets from watching people on a stage) which plays on everyone's terror of a white lie escalating to monstrous consequences. All of the main players are mesmerising. Tom Wilkinson broke my heart at the end... and everyone else's judging by the amount of fumbling for hankies and hands going up to faces among males and females alike. Julian Fellowes has triumphed again. He's a national treasure.

Barbora Bobulova's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time. It has been a long time since I have seen so much hidden passion and mystique presented by any actor simply by utilizing her facial features and the use of her eyes and mouth the way Barbora does with this character. She was entirely believable as Valeria and I was swept away with her characterisation of this role. All at once the film was real life and fantasy, the clever use of what was limited dialogue left me spellbound.

My husband and I watched this last night...It was wonderful....For once he was wrong in guessing ahead of time the suspenseful ending. It moved along very quickly and the acting was superb.. I adore Tom Wilkinson anyway. He has never made a bad movie as far as I'm concerned. The above description of his acting hits the nail on the head... The facial expressions are incredible. Even the picturesque scenery is awesome. We have just finished watched all of the Prime Suspect series and I am convinced that the British have a way of capturing the audience.

**1/2 Elisha Cuthbert, Chad Michael Murray, Brian Van Holt, Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams. Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra.Yet another classic horror film remade with dunder-headed teenage acting despite grizzly and creative deaths. Based on the 1953 Vincent Price film House of Wax where a maniac kills unsuspecting teenage hooligans and turns them into priceless wax figures. Still with the fantastic set design to make the whole house into wax the movie is a typical classic horror remake like Tobe Hooper's 1974 classic Texas Chainsaw Massacre later remade, despite creativity and so-so acting the movie was still just a gore picture.

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground, and in particular the "flowering" of one of them. An embittered, "Spike"-type youth (McAvoy) with Deuchennes MD is placed in a home for the disabled and quickly makes friends with a youth (Robertson) with cerebral palsy. Robertson has never known anything outside of the home, but McAvoy has and he is bound and determined to get back into the real world. Together, they manage to do just that in this funny and heartwarming and often heartbreaking tale of inner strength overcoming physical shortcomings.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time. Excellent original music, clever, heady...it's hard to be articulate about something this good. There isn't one character that you don't instantly love to watch- Myronex "Putney, there's trouble in the black room!" "My name is Rufus." The lines, thrown away left and right, are classics themselves, recalling Slapshot, Caddyshack, Anchorman, Repoman, Dolemite, any comedy whose dialog is not of the formulaic set-up punchline variety. "Putney, Myronex called you tasteless!"

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ("Three Minutes"), the survivors are shocked to find out who the occupant is. With the use of the boat, Jack and Sayid come up with a plan to confront "The Others". However, when Jack, Sawyer, Kate and Hurley follow Michael to "The Others", Jack is forced to reveal Michael's deadly secret whilst they are in the middle of nowhere.Meanwhile, Locke decides that the time has come to find out the time has come to find out what will happen if "the button" is not pressed.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie . I am not saying this lightly . I loved the film . I actually did like the film . I think that the movie is just fine . However , it is not perfect . I am going to do one thing here . After watching the movie , I thought I will tell you what I liked . I liked it as I thought it was entertaining . I thought that the movie had its good point . I also enjoyed the songs . I liked the score . It is not bad .

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television ( RTL7 , around 1800hrs ) and I still watch this every day to check the weather news. I know it’s not weather related, but even if it was, its not like any of the big news are reporting on it anyway and it’s not newsworthy anyway. Just to add, if you are going to a place where the news is not reported by a journalist, you need to at least make sure you do your homework to get to the source, even if it is someone else.

This is possibly one of my favorite films. It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda (Chelsea Hobbs) who lost her mother at a very young age, so has been bought up by her father. She falls in love with the bell boy named Kai. However, on her birthday the snow queen (Bridget Fonda) comes the the hotel which her father owns and kidnaps Kai. Gurda then goes after Kai, and follows him through the four seasons in an attempt to rescue him.I thought that this was an excellent adaption of the story with great performances from all the cast.

Loved today's show!!! It was a variety and not solely cooking (which would have been great too). Very stimulating and captivating, always keeping the viewer peeking around the corner to see what was coming up next. She is as down to earth and as personable as you get, like one of us which made the show all the more enjoyable. Special guests, who are friends as well made for a nice surprise too. Loved the 'first' theme and that the audience was invited to play along too.

Thursday, August 24, 2010

A friend of mine used to say that life is too short to spend every moment of it in bed with a partner who will not share your dreams with you. So I thought that it was time to try something different. In the process I discovered that I don't need partners in life, I can be myself and have fun, and be happy with myself.

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's not even a movie , it has to be said. This is the film that Showtime made it clear they wanted to be , in the sense that it will make you go "oh my god , this is the kind of stuff Showtime is good at ! I 've seen a bunch of bad ones before , this just looks like one. I 'm sure they can find other people they like who are good too .

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war . The rain is constant. The mud is everywhere. The enemy is relentless. There is nothing left but to keep on going until the end. The end may not be very far away as we enter the first year of the Great War. This was the first film to win Oscars for Best Actor for Charlie Chaplin and Best Director for George Stevens. The movie is also known for the line “When the war is over you’re going to feel so happy you might even cry”.

I absolutely adore this movie ! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store but now that I have it and it's on DVD I can't wait to watch it ! It's the best movie ever I think . I love it. It was so awesome. I really enjoyed the story line . I liked how the characters and the plot line went together really well . I had no clue about this movie at all . This movie is amazing . I love how it was all put together . It was so good and the acting was really well done .

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear we all have. Fear of rejection, fear of intimacy and most importantly fear of our own inadequacies.The three lead actors, Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo are match well to their roles and are excellent. It was a joy to witness the dynamic between the three of them as it seemed real.I believe Barbora Bobulova is a stand out. I hope we see much more of her in the coming years.This film doesn't take the easy way out.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David . . . and it’s great . . . I just love this book. But, just a few pages into the book, it becomes clear to me that this book is not for everyone. It’s not really meant to be read by everyone, and while it might have its appeal for some who have already read the book or are familiar with it, I don’t think I could read the book and enjoy it, or recommend it to people.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman's other movie, The Snowman. The Snowqueen revolves around three different lovers: the Snow Queen, her Snow Prince and the Snow King. The Snow Queen loves him passionately, but he doesn't fall for the Snow Queen until the Snow King shows up on her doorstep. He's a man in love with the Snow Queen, and he wants to use her to get back at the Snow Queen and make things right.

Oh my gosh ! ! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! I’m on the fence whether this movie will be good or not . It is sooooooooooo cute and the girl in this movie is so soooooo cute . Thats all I’m sayin . . . ! . . . . ! ! ! I have to admit this movie sucks and there was just tooooooo much crying and not enough action .!! ! ! . . . . ! . . . . . !

I saw this film at a small screening. Even though it had a low budget, the creative direction and intelligence of the cast helped make this a small gem of a movie. It's April 8, 1994, each of the characters are in their "mid 20's" and pursuing some kind of artistic ambition (acting, music, film, writing) when they learn of Nirvana singer Kurt Cobain's suicide. They quickly get inspiration to travel from San Francisco to Seattle and attend the Cobain vigil. It's here where the film really picks up and serves up a series of funny and emotional scenes.

I thought it was brilliant ! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down . Dwight is the most popular guy in the world ! He has done more interviews since he came into the sport. He is an inspiration to all the guys that follow him. I really do enjoy it when he takes the mic back for a few seconds and gives a few highlights. He is one of the best. I was really excited to hear him do some interview with the guys after his win last night . He did great and I wish him the best of luck .

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

I do n't see that much wrong with this movie . Granted , the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Anna Moffo . It's probably more appropriate for Anna to be the lead singer. This is her first movie. And it's an all Italian movie - it's about Italy and their relationship with Europe. But the lead singer? Anna Moffo?! No way! That's ridiculous! That's just ridiculous! You don't have to take that away from him. I can totally see her in the title song.

This was a riveting film, one that really drew me in. I'm a big fan of William H. Macy, and he puts in a wonderful performance. His great likeability, coupled with the way his character breaks the fourth wall, really gave me a sense of complicity in his actions. I found myself waiting tensely for the whole house of cards to come collapsing down around him (and by extension myself, as his confidante and silent witness). It took several minutes for me to relax once the film had ended, I was so wrapped up in it.

I Loved this movie . Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role . More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade in this style . Not one thing wrong with this classic horror film . The acting , music and story lines were all solid . It had a certain feel that I had seen in many Sci-Fi and Horror films . I have watched a couple of this films and I loved every one of them . I thought this was the best one of the bunch . This is a classic horror movie and the music in it was great . The story line was well written .

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song , and now the terrific Justin Bieber’s “Baby” has been chosen by The Voice judges as one of the Top Ten Songs of the Year. The original “Baby” hit number one in 2010. In his debut appearance on The Voice the singer performed “Baby, Baby, Baby.”

The judges voted him out after he had performed this song on the first show, and he performed it again in the third and fourth rounds. Justin Bieber is known for being an original member of the Backstreet Boys.

I wonder why I haven't heard of this movie before. It's truly a magnificent comedy (I'd say farce, but it's too well acted and I'd hate to denigrate it's quality). A comedic character study about the travails of mid-life crises, the inequity for gays who can't have their long-time unions recognized, and the general differences of people who can't fit nicely into society, that pairs Kathy Bates and Rupert Everett to a wonderful effect. Forget Julia Roberts and Rupert; Kathy Bates and Rupert should do another movie together.

When the new Outer Limits first started , the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging . As the series began , the episodes got less adventurous and more predictable . The episodes also started to get a bit repetitive as they felt like they were going to keep going for quite a while . The show also started to get predictable as they tried to get you in the mood for the story . The first half of the first season of OI started with the main theme of “ “ . This theme lasted throughout the series for a few episodes .

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow . It accomplished this through the energetic performances of its leads as well as in the script and performances of its actors . The movie was a hit , even though its plot and characters may have disappointed some fans of rock biopics . At its core, this film is an exploration of drug addiction and its effects on society and on the individuals involved . The movie is based in and around drug use , addiction , and death . But the movie is not just about those things.

'Captain Corelli 's Mandolin ' is a fantastic film in itself . It is nothing like the book , which is also very good but is more of a children's book . I really liked the ending , the ending of the novel , and I liked a few of the details in the book . But all of it was just so good ! I would recommend this film as a must see . I would recommend this film to people my age or above . It has great story and wonderful music . This review is a bit late but I can not get over it .

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a non-disabled role? His performance was so convincing as the disabled person in the role as well; it looked so real, and seemed so believable. What makes his performance so convincing is that he has the ability to play the disabled character as well. I have watched many disabled people portray themselves in such a dramatic way on screen. What I found most unique about him was the way he portrayed the disabled character. To me, it felt really natural and true.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert. A brutal but beautiful world that is explored through memories and edgy layers of sound and score. The landscape develops its own persona, paralleling the inner geography of all three characters as their stories unfold. The stark void of lost love, the fear of the unknown, and then transcendence of emptiness through the very openness of this desolation. Three misguided souls fighting to find something absolute and positive in all that negative space. The drama is compelling. James Franco and his co-stars deliver deft performances.

Well, what's wrong with the title "Separate Lies" (accused elsewhere of not being "exciting"). It's cunning, subtle and a bit poetic. (Of course there's a Phil Collins song and a James Belushi film called "Separate Lives", which are alluded to here.) But the real point is the ethical dilemmas of telling lies at different levels that the film probes. OK, it's not an "in-your-face" hilarious title, but then it's not an in-your-face hilarious film. Please give British films like this a chance.

I always liked this movie , I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it : )



But in my opinion, I don't really like it. The music is great and the story is interesting. I would like to like this more than I dislike it. I'd like a sequel with a bit more substance. I will be a bit disappointed if I don't like this at all. Might as well go out with a whim. It's all a matter of opinion. I found it to be good , it's not the best but it has a lot of potential.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film ( which is excellent ) . It borrows a lot of scenes from the film and a few scenes from the 1958 film . The original O'Brien movie is on Netflix, and if you can watch it with a popcorn and a soda, you'll find it to be the better film . You don't need to see the remake for that . The plot is as follows . O'Brien, an Irish-born American man, returns to live in Ireland and be a farmer. O'Brien lives a life of luxury and luxury becomes his mistress .

Easily Lucio Fulci 's most respected film , `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is highly renowned for it's dark, disturbing, gory and macabre themes that make you question your own humanity. In this documentary, Fulci explores the idea of killing a human being for his or her death. `` A film like this one needs to take place somewhere in the real world to make any sense at all. How can you kill an entire person in cold blood for being a human being? What is the point of this film?'' Fulci wondered.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love, passion, and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in his latest film BLINDSPOT.BLINDSPOT'S diegetic world is exploding with suspense and takes the audience on a twisting  journey to the core of the human soul. As a director, he manages to draw the human spirit from the performances of his actors. With superb editing, especially in the flashback scenes and beautiful cinematography, BLINDSPOT is a thought provoking suspense from beginning to end. A thriller which leaves much to the minds' eye.What an  astounding accomplishment for Stephan Woloszczuk. Cheers Stephan!

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply. I've been looking for this movie on DVD for a while and VHS for years. One can get all sorts of movies on line...old movies, new movies... but it all targets a particular group. This movie is very nostalgic for many. I'm not sure why I can't get a copy. Maybe if enough people will write in, the copyright holder will get a clue. It's about time for this to happen. Yes, it's date, but so is The Wizard of OZ.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10, and it just blew my mind every week with each episode, every episode had a twist and each week I couldn't wait for the next. How the writers managed to do every episode so well and make it different from each over a course of 7 seasons is beyond me. This show manages to teach us about life, robotics, Alien and human encounters, and an insight into more of the paranormal, and how it affects the people.

"D.O.A" is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish. Dennis Quaid is at his caustic best; and Quaid is sadly one of the most underused talents in Hollywood. His then beau Meg Ryan also appears with him, but as is usually the case, doesn't really make much of an impact. The film is stylishly directed throughout, drawing on a number of influences to capture its 'seamy' feel. Would you credit that it's actually directed by two people? The answer is no. The whole thing is superbly slick, from its innovative camerawork to its unabashed use of black and white photography.

I admit to being in awe of the Sea and have spent a number of years in the Navy , but now I have to make it clear, this is my blog. It is NOT a Navy publication or official Navy site. It does not claim to be the official Naval Aviation News, and I have no connection with them in any capacity. However, this blog does cover my personal experience of the Navy as well as Navy aviation, so you won't find a lot of Navy stuff here. This blog will be dedicated to providing my perspective on what life has been like for me.

First of all , around the time I wrote this comment , I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written. So, what has been done since then, in response to what I wrote, is to make more detailed arguments, which I am going to make available as a follow up to the first comment. The following is a more detailed description of how the arguments work. I'm going to make a new blog, a blog that will contain some of my work over the next year, to make this work more smoothly.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . The first time I heard it, I thought it was so weird, I couldn't get it out of my mind. Even though I'd never seen it, the music, the acting, the dancing, it was the perfect match to the characters, the story . It is the definition of campiness! LOST HORN is the third movie I've ever been forced to watch. I didn't know if I was in the right town, or even if I liked it.

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

Valeria, an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and depression. Although she may have a one-night lover or if someone lives with her, it makes no difference of being completely alone. Valeria is also a passionate woman who can take actions to approach that special man, Massimo, and at the same time the fear that allows her to answer his questions only with a "yes", "no" or "I don't know". The way to accent the loneliness of the character is magnificent.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu, being Greek I adore my country and I liked the flattering director's point of view. Based on a true story during the years when Greece was struggling to stand on her own two feet through war, Nazis and hardship. An Italian soldier and a Greek girl fall in love but the times are hard and they have a lot of sacrifices to make. Nicholas Cage looking great in a uniform gives a passionate account of this unfulfilled (in the beginning) love.

I love the TV contest . Hate to see it end . There are so many talented contestants . It's not a one-shot show and it's only been a few weeks. I have no idea who will win but I will watch to see . __________________

__________________

Quote:

Greetings. I know there will be questions, and there always is. But please try to keep your questions civil. We like to hear different things. I hope you've had a great time, and are able to spend more time on your blog. I know it can be difficult sometimes to keep in touch with everyone.

This is what movies should aspire to. Funny without being totally stupid, a little sexy without having every female in the cast show her boobs, biting without resorting to 'f-bombs' every line. I've been seeing Justin Long pop up in a lot of films over the past few years, I figured with the right role he could break out. (Mac commercials not withstanding.) This film just might put him on a fast track to the A list. The rest of the cast also did their jobs perfectly, this is an excellent little film with a nice message.

I can't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I've described that scene to folks not familiar with this film. I saw it the year it was released, I was 19. I don't think there were a dozen people in that East Village theater that night. For years I thought we were the only ones who saw it. Nice to see here that others found it as hysterical as I had, and see it's lasting value despite the time gone by. Rent it, buy it or steal it.... a must see.

It 's up there with Where 's Poppa , The Groove Tube , Putney Swope . It memorializes the NY subway system in general, not just New Haven's subway in particular. It's a cool place to go and has some good photo ops of it in action. Here you can find a photo of where it is located and where it was built , and there you can get more information on their website. You can also go on their facebook page for a lot more information. This place is a lot of fun for kids to play, as well as very educational.

I 'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci 's films . Most of his 80s gore films had their day . But I do like the fact that he keeps trying to reinvent his art. For example , I 'm happy to see him get some new roles . I'm also happy about the fact that he's getting some more good ones as well . And I' ll look to see how well he continues to evolve with these films. I 've liked his films . but I ' m not sure I can stand all his sequels .

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the days of apartheid. It shows how this hate was contrived and was groomed from generation to generation. Jan Ellis was taught that a black man was a plague. He was raised to be that way. Then he meets a man who is on the opposite side of his beliefs, Pastor Lekota. will he change his ways?. The film is a powerful movie that shows the perceptions the different races had for one another, it shows these perceptions with quite a lot of accuracy.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS ... Hmm .... Only that this was one of the most entertaining and enjoyable TV shows I have ever seen or heard .... It's like an episode of THE MANHATTAN SHANGHAI .... The only thing missing from this series (and even that it was just a tad bit too much) was some of the action/violence ... It was a series filled with action and suspense .... and it really made me think ... I have never seen a show like this or even read an article of one like it before ... Well I can say ...

`` Hari om '' is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name. It was made in 1975. In the story, Hari is the leader of a guerrilla group and in the first half of the film he is sent on a mission. In the second half of the movie we meet him again in the company of the young soldier. Hari was one of the most loved and well liked actors in Hindi Cinema. He was also loved and well liked by the people of Hindi Cinema for his roles and also as a man of valour and courage that he always had.

1930's comedy mystery about "The Crooked Circle" a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the murder of some one who swore to oppose them. Enjoyable but really unremarkable little film, the movie works simply because the cast headed by Zazu Pitts and James Gleason (both of whom would later appear together in a couple of Hildegarde Withers films after Edna Mae Oliver dropped out of that series) and supported by a great cast of actors and actresses you know but may not know the name of (I don't hence the lack naming).

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films , it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment . The film has been seen as one of the better examples of its kind , and also the closest thing to the idea that I had in mind when I saw it on a DVD box set . It's not a good film for all people , but for some people , it will be a better option that other post apocalyptic films . And even if you do not like the ending , you will probably still watch it for some of the movie's most interesting parts .

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining . It provides updates of tech news , video reviews of movies and tv shows. I will be honest I like to read tech news on a daily basis as well as to see what new and emerging technology is coming out in the world. I also enjoy watching movies. I am able to enjoy movies that are out right now as well as some movies that will come out very soon. I think the show provides very detailed info about the upcoming new technology that will be available for purchase.

What a surprise this film was . I 've seen a good few of Fulci 's horror and zombie flicks ,but never have I seen a movie with as much darkness, suspense and gore . The director is a true master and I can't wait until I see his next offering . The best part about it is that Fulci makes this film his own ! I think it's a masterpiece and I 'll certainly be seeing it one day and if it's not, I hope it will make me very upset ! I have to say it is the first film that really scares me.

Very touching film, a great surprise to come up from Brazil, a country that usually exports features about social themes, violence, sex... Magical realism is a very hard task, and I believe João Falcão has made it wonderfully. It seems that he really didn't intend to make a realistic film, far from that. Although many people think the film was adapted from the play, he said in his interviews that he actually based the film on the book. Another mistake is to think that Falcão has been influenced by the series "Hoje é Dia De Maria".

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once, about ten years ago. I remember I liked the book a lot, and this movie does a good job in telling the story. The most important thing in this movie isn't the story, however, but the highly original visual look it has.The visuals are absolutely beautiful, and they are apparently achieved by a clever combination of animated drawings combined with live actors, stop-motion animation and sets that are painted so that they look much like from an animated movie.
