Well, happily, my fears were unjustified and the movie is such a wonderful and delicate piece of art.I can't recall of any other movie that could bring tears to my eyes due to the very beauty of the text.

Considering it 's basically low-budget cast , this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock star Frank Zappa. It has a good pace that doesn't bog down but it's a shame the writing isn't a little better and the acting is so mediocre that you wonder why they thought it was worth paying the extra $10 to watch. The thing about Zappa is that you can be pretty sure that this movie was made in the late '60s or early '70s because the music from this movie sounds like it was made at least a few years before that time period.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink in 1956 Lubbock, Texas. As the credits start, the camera moves down from the moon to the parking lot, into the roller rink, past the concessions and across the rink to a small bandstand where a small band is doing their sound check. It's a tracking shot Welles and Scorcese would both appreciate. It cuts to Buddy Holly's bespectacled face peering down in rapt concentration as he grips the headphones and talks to a man putting this band on the radio.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads. The movie is about Bartelby .B. Gaines a guy who has rejected from all the colleges he has applied for so decides to make his own college and invites all the other people who did not make it, problem is hundreds of people sign up to his school. The movie is hilarious and I was lucky enough to buy it for $5.00 at a sale and I have always watched it since. Overall this movie is a must watch for fans of all comedy as it is funny, witty and just a good movie all up.

This movie felt so real . I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various times, even though we never met or talked to one another. I have a lot of memories of this movie, from the first scene to the end. It was a really good movie and worth the price. It is one of those films I would love to watch again now and I think you get what you pay for, but for those who are looking for something a little different, this was worth the cost. I am going to be watching this one many times again .

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it. I thought it was a fascinating mix of comedy, drama and action. Now that it’s been out for some years I’m rewatching it with my friends to get to know it again, and this time a lot more. I’m going to try and give a couple of impressions of this one. The Plot:

What I’m going to say is, this is not a really interesting film to watch.

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times. I taped it in about 1987 when it was shown on Channel Four but my tape is severely worn now and I would love a new copy of it.I have e-mailed Film Four to ask them to show it again as it has never been available on video and as far as I know hasn't been repeated since the 80's. I have had no reply and it still hasn't been repeated. The performances are superb. The film has everything. Its funny,sad,disturbing,exciting and totally takes you back to school days.

Really , This movie should be released to DVD . I just got a bootleg copy of what I think is the original from some guy who is in his mid-60s, but is probably older than that.It's really good. "I believe the people who try to tell me what to do are the people who will never let me forget how good they were. "- George Carlin

This movie is fantastic. It has everything you could want from a movie, from the acting, the story, the pacing, the music, the cinematography, the special effects, the direction of the action...and the acting.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

the first time I saw this movie, I just thought "what the hell?" a 10-year-old kid driving around bizarre places, meeting bizarre people, going after a game called MOTORAMA! Hell yeah! I enjoyed this movie a lot!Jordan Christopher-Michael is a brilliant young actor! It's a shame he stopped act. He interprets very well his character Gus on the movie.Gus loses an eye, got tattoos and go at the most weird cities acting with Flea, Drew Barrymore and Meat Loaf! Want more? OK, don't even try to understand the story, but why this movie needs one!?

If you like who-dun-its , you will like this film , considered the best Italian detective story ( giallo ) in decades, from writer/director Mario Bava , produced by Cinecittà Films ( Italy ), distributed by Columbia/Sony ( USA ) ( Italy ). Director and star Mario Bava , born in Varese , where his mother worked as a nurse , is not a native of Rome . He studied drama in Turin for four years , graduating from the prestigious Liceo Classico in 1973 , before moving on to Rome where, as he recalls, "I wanted to do theater, but then I became interested in movies.

Is this a good movie ? It 's hard to say -- but in 1953 , for many people , the film was an essential part of cinematic history, and even today , the film still speaks a powerful truth. I have always felt that if you want something to be remembered, you should not give it away. Not for free or cheap. The film was not only a work of art, the story is still remembered and still relevant today. That's true. But if you don't want to watch it, it's easy enough to find a copy on line .

This Oscar-winning short film (40 minutes), based on a short story by William Faulkner, takes us back to small-town Tennessee in December 1941. Two brothers, one about 18 and one about 8 are looking for birds eggs (obviously a huge collectors item for boys in the South around this time). Well, the Japanese bomb Pearl Harbor and the older brother, Pete, decides to enlist. He gives his prize egg to his little brother, Willie and heads off wishing to show more emotion and tenderness to his little acolyte.

Jeff Garlin 's film is filled with heart and laughter . As in Curb Your Enthusiasm , his screen persona of the self-deprecating, wacky, and, of course, funny guy is an actor that we can all relate to. And yet Garlin’s film doesn’t seem to be trying too hard to connect with us. In fact, Garlin lets us know exactly why that is by doing exactly what he does best . He directs the film, and lets us know that the film exists in a very real world.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage. I was wondering if there is any video that I could download that will show this effect. If there is then I'll put the link here. Thanks in advance. Well I would imagine that most people would have already seen the concert footage. So, if you wanted to go and watch the concert, you would probably have to wait a bit, or maybe not, depending on how long you saw the video.

This is one of the best of the early `` Star Trek '' episodes , with Kirk and his crew on the surface of a world in which time has become warped. At the same time that the humans are on board the ship, we are shown a view of the planet, the surface is covered with mountains, forests and a vast river system, which flows from the mountain ranges of the land. There are two types of creatures: one type live in caves and are covered with fur and the other live in trees and have very sharp teeth.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films, it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment. The most noticed element of the film is its silence; no one speaks. I don't think Besson, despite what is evident in most of his later work, meant it as any kind of cool gimmick. I think what makes it so clever and so effective is the fact that with no other way of communicating, everyone has to read each other based on intuition and conveying of emotion, no matter how slight.

What a great film! I never knew much about Buddy Holly, but was familiar with his lively and fun music. This is a wonderful biography of someone who helped change the music in the 1950's. Although I never cared for Gary Bussey, he was fabulous as Buddy Holly! I don't know how accurate the movie is, but assume at least for the most part it is accurate, which makes the movie all the more interesting. The music throughout the movie just adds the pizazz to this biography. I don't think I would change a thing in this film, it was all good!

This movie was great . It had everything a true action fan could want . Plenty of people getting shot , all the guns and explosives and a great cast to go along side . It was great fun . I loved every second of it . Great movie . I could watch it all day . If you liked this movie you should buy a copy of this DVD

Watch the movie. It's fun, action-packed, and completely ridiculous. When I was a child I had just seen The Godfather II with a lot of my friends. When my wife was a teenager she had seen that movie as well.

As a film buff, I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny, sarcastic comments about this film (my favourite being Woody Allen's quip "If I had my life to live over again I wouldn't change anything ... except for seeing the musical remake of Lost Horizon"). Therefore I've never been able to watch it without smirking at the choreography/set/songs etc. Just recently I came across a widescreen DVD and watched it for the first time in years, along with a friend who had never heard of the film's reputation.

This is one of my favorite films , ever . The story is just so fantastic and the characters are great. I recommend it for sure . But there are quite a few flaws . One major flaw that I would want to say is there is no music in the movie , just the voice of the one guy. But the movie has some great music . The music is great and the movie is just awesome. So I am telling everyone to watch this movie ! It is a must see ! ************

It is very well acted .

William H. Macy always gives a good performance . He never looks lazy and never seems like he 'd rather be talking than acting . I think this is the reason I always watch his movies . The only time I can see a 'd like him is when he takes the character seriously . In the movies, he is always good at playing a serious guy . I can't say I have seen too many that are good at it . John Barrymore always makes me smile . Maybe that is because he always looks so nice and sweet . He never seems as silly and 'd play up to his role .

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written by the man responsible for the best-selling film adaptation of the novel , composer John Adams. Adams wrote the original book and provided the music for the film's original cast , while Hunter 's version was written as a companion piece for the original film . This is the final of five installments chronicling the life of the film's main character. Hilton's beloved book is considered by many critics to be among the finest works of fiction ever written.

When his elderly mother Emily ( Jeanne Bates ) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier ( Brion James ) at the chateau of Chambord, Jean-Baptiste becomes a member of a band of assassins sent to assassinate him. The plot thickens when Duvalier is killed in the midst of his own assassination attempt when he is caught by his mistress, who then attempts to force her husband into suicide. The plan goes awry and he is killed in cold blood by the band of his own assassins, who take over his private chapel, and bury the body. Jean-Baptiste is sent to the guillotine for his crimes.

Lucio Fulci's "Don't Torture a Duckling" paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by series of brutal murders of young boys.This surprisingly well-directed film(especially in comparison to later Fulci's gorefests)is distinguished by overall atmosphere of perversity,nastiness and two truly grotesque scenes of brutal violence.The soon-to-be-dead children are depicted as casually cruel and budding peeping toms;Bruno's near-seduction by the naked Patrizia(Barbara Bouchet)really has to be seen to be believed.Highly recommended-especially in pair with my another cult favourite "House with the Windows That Laugh"(1976).

It's up there with Where's Poppa, The Groove Tube, Putney Swope. It memorializes the NY city mind set of the period, a wonderfully strange man with a bizarre plan, hoist by by own petard, and at last retreating into the bed of his adoptive parents. Totally absurd, its the life one sees through the magic glasses, seeing things as they "really are"... I don't think it is ever shown anymore. If so, surely someone would Tivo the thing and put it out there.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard ( Beau Travail ) , Golden Door is a visually striking tone-on-tone piece that brings to mind an old Hollywood film noir. In the mid-1990s, in the wake of 9/11 attacks, Golden Door was awarded a BAFTA and Golden Globe for the Best Film in the Best Foreign Language Film categories. Although the title is a play on words, it is actually the title of one of Godard’s two previous films, Chocolat (1991) , which is loosely based on the life of a French pastry chef in the early years of the French Revolution.

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the assassination of the owner of a local restaurant, and the ensuing confrontation with his wife, which leads to a showdown with the gangsters. History

The book was published by Harper in October 1933 as The Crooked Circle; it was republished in 1975. Plot 
It begins with a man and his wife, who are going through a bad marriage. As they are driving away from a restaurant in the city, they are stopped by two men.

Some days ago , in Rome , a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a young woman in a bar. The news of his attack has gone largely unnoticed in his native Romania , even though he had committed the same offence in his own country several years prior. But the Romanian media have picked up on this latest case , and have gone into overdrive trying to find a motive for the brutal assault. On the one side , there are the usual suspects – ‘murderers, paedophiles’.

I thought Besson's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them; Capture true human emotions. The main character's struggles, triumphs, set backs, hopes and desires are all so honestly shown that you wonder if he is acting at all. The film has a low budget and is obviously made without the glitz and glamour afforded to most Hollywood productions but that minimalism is what allows this film to transcend the stereotypical Sci-Fi labeling and become a true drama. However calling this film solely a drama would take away from the fantastic post-apocalyptic plot.

I really enjoyed this film , it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat . It was very well paced and made us care about the characters in the storyline . The cinematography is excellent and the soundtrack is good as well . Just overall a great film , it had a great story to tell . This was a great film. It was well paced and had a good story to tell. It is not my favorite, but it certainly wasn't the least bit inferior to some of the other excellent, well made horror films.

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war. Everything about the movie was perfect. I just saw the movie yesterday and I want to get my own DVD asap and watch it many times over. The story ends as it started I was very happy that he came back and I was proud of her for becoming a doctor and fulfilling her father's dream. She honored her father, boyfriend-husband, and her lover. The character had many shades. Christian Bale is also an phenomenal actor. Some stories do have happy endings.

Better than it has any right to be, this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office. At times sophomoric, at others, bitingly satirical and witty, Jekyll and Hyde is mostly just a near perfect reflection of the times, laden with drug and sexual humor, reminding one at one time or another of everything from the Woody Allen of "Everything You Always Wanted To know About Sex" to the Mel Brooks of "The Producers", Saturday Night Live to Monty Python, Carlin to Cheech and Chong.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

I admit to being in awe of the Sea and have spent a number of years in the Navy, so I am somewhat biased on this one. I missed this documentary when it first came out but nagged various people to buy me it on DVD this Christmas (2002) and I got it! Some of the film is amazing and I have a lot of respect for those who make these kinds of documentaries, to see 200 ton Blue Whales 'cruising' through the Sea is an incredible sight, they looked like submarines.

`` Head '' is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968 . The story is set in the English countryside at the beginning of the 20th century and centres on the lives of a group of women who live in a village. It is based on the true events and experiences of these women during a time when there was no other film to tell their story . This film has never been released in the US but was released to the UK . The film has won numerous awards and was screened at the 1968 Berlin Film Festival .

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie , this wo n't be one for you . If you want to watch a classic Hollywood action movie , then this may not be for you. If you are wondering why a classic Hollywood action movie is considered a fake Hollywood movie, then I will explain. The fake Hollywood action movie is based in a movie genre which has become popular over the last decade , and this movie genre is known as the action flick . The film industry has produced several Hollywood movies in this genre .

Like some people here , I love/loved Stingers ! In Norway it got aired a lot later . That also has a good point, we don't know anything about Stingers so it's not just a "what does this guy think he is?" kind of show with no answers or explanations. I'm glad that they did a rewatch of all their previous recordings, so I don't need to hear some of the stuff I already know, but they also need to have a few surprises, not the usual "This is not what he said in the first episode" surprises.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode, beside Peter Falk, you have Julie Newmar, Jeannette Nolan, Martin Landau as twins. Anyway, the old uncle dies mysteriously and it looks like a heart attack on the bicycle discovered by his fiancé, Julie Newmar, who plays the role so deliciously. Jeannette Nolan plays the other woman of the house, the housekeeper who prides herself on her talents and chides Columbo's sloppy and often typical behavior with his cigar. Martin Landau plays identical twins in this one. Each who accuse the other of murdering their uncle for money.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. The only good that came from it was this movie, "Take it to Limit" Right as the movie started, we could tell we were in for a true classic. The music is probably done by rural white boys from Colorado, but it sounds just like early 90's rap. The star of the show, actor Leo Fitzpatrick, plays the bad-boy so well, especially sporting a big zit the entire movie.

This movie got better with time . I ca n't believe that it has been forty years since I saw it. And it has. It is a classic, for a reason. I was a child at the time and I had no understanding of what I was seeing or what it was. I didn't understand that this movie was what people did. That it was a story about a family, about a community, about a society. And the message was that all people have value and that they should be looked after. And what they did was that they raised children that were different.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White , Cinderella , or Bambi , but it IS a very beautiful film, and is worth watching, if only for its special effects. In Snow White , for example, we are given some very beautiful shots of the mountains, such as these:









Here, we are not given any special effects or special effects for Cinderella, Snow White, or Bambi, but I can understand how some of you might not like seeing those shots, and would rather see more of just the scenery. It is a matter of taste.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before, should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse' Although I prefer Ali G when he is interviewing the rich and famous, his brand of completely off the wall comedy definitely entertains from start to finish on the big screen too.Ridiculous plot, ridiculous characters and a ridiculous script, that all make this film a riot for fans of Ali G.If you've seen him and didn't like him then avoid this film like the plague, because it's definitely just more of the same; for everybody else - watch it Aiiii!

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman:TAS and its ilk, I enjoyed it in my youth and recently had been able to watch them all again, great voice acting from Tim Curry, Richard Moll, Tony Jay, and Maurice LaMarche in various roles. The only qualm I had was Rob Paulsons voice seemed a little too old for the title character, but that wasn't a big deal as the stories were great, and the fact that the whole thing has a great time loop twist ending.

The Child 's Play series is n't a favourite of mine , but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay series . What's really great is the fact that this is just a really great series . The story is so clever . There's a lot of suspense in this story , and it has just been very well written . One of my favourite characters in this story is the girl whose name is not really given . She doesn't have to have a name , but the way she's described in the book means that you can picture her .

Made at the height of the Black Power movement, this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope (Arnold Johnson) getting made CEO of a corporation after the white CEO dies (the white executives all hate each other and can't decide who should succeed the previous CEO). Once in power, he decides to turn it into a militant organization.I don't know how Robert Downey Sr did it, but he did it! "Putney Swope" is the ultimate jab at America's power structure. It's the sort of thing that seems like it would have come out of Richard Pryor's mind.

it's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar fight, and get into serious trouble. they find themselves fighting some shadowy people, and can't deal with. very, very disturbing portrayal of japan, the arbitrariness of modern life... some intense scenes, but a bit of a potboilerthe spoiler was that the plot is not too clear based on English sub titles. obviously, i don't know Japanese.the only other Japanese movies i've seen were kurosawa, who is a different and far loftier than this modern genre.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink. “Lucky in love, lucky in death,” the song goes. And you know what they mean. The song has been a constant companion of mine since first hearing it as a girl in the early ‘90s. Buddy Holly’s death on the day he was born, July 17, 1957, was a turning point for me, a turning point for his fans, and the entire music industry.

This is a good film, no doubt, but with some odd aspects. Without spoiling anything it takes place in 3 places only- a Sicilian farm, the boat,and Ellis Island New York. All shots are close up so we never see a broad sweep of anything. I wonder if this was to save money? No street scenes anywhere, and we don't even see the boat except in close ups. And the music...what on earth was going on with playing Nina Simone songs, decades before they were out?

I first saw `` Signs of Life '' on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation . It 's a wonderfully moving film. But even though it's so beautifully done, this movie doesn't even pretend to tell the entire story. All the characters are just stereotypes, and that's how I felt as a child watching it. There was only one main character, who was a doctor. That's it. It didn't tell the story of how an alien lifeform landed in our home, how it found us, where it came from, and why it took so long for us to notice it.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house. It's a very positive and happy type of music. The movie has some sad parts but mostly the music is what makes me happy. Gary Busey did a great job as Buddy Holly. Buddy Holly kept on going even tho his pastor, his parents and the Nashville record producer told him no. Buddy Holly didn't give up on what he liked. I didn't know much about Buddy Holly until I watched this movie.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris

She lives there and is fed on special cat food in her own home. But she doesn't know she is being fed cat food. It all began for her when her owner sent a gift of food and toys to the Duchess of Windsor who was staying in Paris for a few weeks. The gift arrived when the duchess was in her late 50s, but she hadn't realised. The food was sent to her as a birthday card.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline. I go to the movies as an escape, to leave everything behind and enjoy a "story". I found this to be a good movie, not great, but good. It was worth my money and my tears :)Diane Lane was wonderful as always, Richard Gere isn't an over-actor. He held his own and has a certain presence that we always come to expect. He brings his own style to the movie.I think it was the kind of love story that doesn't always get told.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it. It's one of the best "teenager" horror films I've ever seen; and that's saying a lot. Nothing is left without an explanation to back it up, the characters and plot break countless horror movie stereotypes, and it has got nothing to do with some other horrible pieces we've been submitted to lately. (A clear example is the mindless "Saint Ange".) The first 30-40 minutes might be downright boring with the exception of the beginning, although some minor light mistakes can be easily spotted.

I don't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor. You need to get your head out of your up-tight ass if you don't find this movie hilarious! If this isn't your "cup of tea", so to speak, then look at it for what it truly is- a damn funny movie. Maybe they DID set out to make yet another drugs/T&A movie, but in this case, they've truly hit the spot. It's especially funny for the Ali G fans, because he delivers everything we've come to love and expect from him.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie . She was only 19 at the time and her first major role was as the young woman who was hired at a brothel. It's not that she was bad at her job, she just didn't know any better. In the end she was just too young to be an adult and too innocent for her role, but she was a good person who just needed help. I love this girl and she is an amazing dancer.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is trying to tell us with this film ,and with the story he is telling about his life and his relationships and what he wanted to accomplish in life . i think its great ,i just find it hard to watch it because i dont see any of the characters , or the story , i feel it is more of a film for teenagers than for adults , i just think it is too much of a movie for me to watch .

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell you the events leading to his capture. After his capture the story continues and ends with him being brought back to the present as a hostage in an effort to find a way out of his situation. This was an interesting game to review and I enjoyed it greatly. The characters were well-drawn, the sound was immersive and the level design was top notch. The only problem I found with the level was that I found it a bit repetitive.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie. She was only 19 years old and gorgeous. What a pleasure to watch her dance with George Murphy. The story line was typical for its day but the dancing was really special. I never tire of watching Fred and Ginger but Lana Turner in this movie was just as terrific. I always thought of Lana as a so-so actress who tended to over act. She should have done more dancing and less of the Maddam X and Peyton Place roles. I had a new appreciation for her after seeing this movie and her wonderful dancing.

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film! Hat's off to Ben Daniels, Lavinia Currier and the great Honore de Balzac. This captivating film conveys the passion experienced by the characters so effortlessly and yet so powerfully. I watched it mesmerized, almost holding my breath as the story developed towards its inexorable end. This film's execution was almost flawless: simple and pure, it plays with our hearts, guiding us in understanding the strange platonic, absolute thus possessive bond between two creatures not meant to be part of each other's world.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David. The actors seem like real people in this fairytale of the outside world meeting with mystical Shangra-la. It is a joy to watch Bobby Van, whose acting puts me in mind of Red Buttons, and, as always, George Kennedy (Cool-Hand Luke) who always manages to carry gravitas in his roles. The surprise here is Charles Boyer as the elder High Lama. Who would have known? All-star cast including Michael York and Olivia Hussey makes this work a keeper for those of us who cherish people.

it 's a great movie for the whole family . i do n't think many people have seen it cause it comes out at the end and i cant wait to see the whole thing again . this movie is the best of all time . i like it . i cant wait to see this again ! I've seen it on DVD, and the one and only thing you have to do is read the whole thing so i can tell if it sucked or not. If you don't watch it you're gonna have a rough time. What an awesome show!

I would say 'Bride of Chucky' is a "return to greatness" but the series was never really great. Very good #1 was, #2-3 were throwaways, and I think this 4th installment is equal to or even better than the first movie. And it contains the best subtitle/tagline: "Chucky Gets Lucky." So he does, in the role of Jennifer Tilly, who thoroughly rejuvenated this series as Jeri Ryan did for 'Star Trek: Voyager.' Tilly didn't just create a presence; she added much needed humor, back-story, drama, tension and a great little sidekick/play-thing for Chucky.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters . I had never heard of this movie before it came out. It was about a young guy who is married to his ex and is in the process of getting another woman. While the wife was out with their friends, the ex and their friend came home and took the wife into a room to make out. This guy and the wife had no idea where the other was, and they didn’t know whether they were married to each other or just friends.

This movie was great. It had everything a true action fan could want. Plenty of people getting shot and/or maimed, minimal romance involving sex, a hero that can be identified with, violence at many intervals instead of pointless plot storing up just one scene at the end, and villains that are just asking for it. Bronson appears to be at his lowest level of tolerancy in this film and it shows. Ed Lauter makes a great cop and was seamlessly worked into Bronson's plot without stealing his spotlight. The movie doesn't involve a plot so boring or over-consuming that you watch this film once and never again.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I've just managed to watch this film for the second time in nearly twenty years, and I can honestly say it hasn't lost any of its kick. I can't believe that Channel 4 have let this one vanish without a trace as it is an extremely powerful, moving and moralistic take on the consequences of misplaced loyalty. It focuses on a clique of friends over the course of ten years and their relationship with two 'outsiders' from school; specifically how they use one and mercilessly torment the other.

This movie is true action at its finest, It doesn't get any better then this. This is one of those movies that you can just kick back and watch some real good non stop shooting and killing plus there are some excellent lines to go along with all of this. My favorite is there is a one bad guy who is breaking into this old couples home and he is stealing a TV or something and he goes right up to them and yells "I will come in here anytime i like!!!" and right before he jumps out the window he yells "Anytime!!!"

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who is in love with Mlle Aurore is all that stands in the way for her to become Mrs. Edgar . When Aurore becomes Mrs. Edgar . Aurore has lost her husband and is on her own . The only family she's ever had is in an orphanage . Aurore has only one goal . To find her missing husband and get back the money he gave her . When she gets involved in the story . Aurore learns that she is not the only one to lose a husband in a different way .

Even after nearly 20 years apart, the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing. In this concert, they perform their best songs from their heyday (1970-1978), including "N.I.B. ", "War Pigs", and "Paranoid".Also included is priceless backstage footage with interviews and retrospectives into their days as the top hard rock band on the planet. The comments of Ozzy, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler, and Bill Ward are just as interesting and intriguing to watch as the fabulous onstage performances.A must-see for all Sabbath and Ozzy fans.

Another go round with the monkey king going west....sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie just goes from the first frame onward.A monk and his three disciples go to a town to get the sacred suras that will bring peace to the world once they are translated and spoken to the world.But an evil force has intervened and kidnapped all of the children of the town. The evil force wants the monk because if you eat him you will live forever. The retainers battle the forces of darkness before forcibly sending the monk off for safety (The monk thinks he can win simply by reasoning with the bad guys).

In the first transformation scene, what is the music? I've heard it was "The Greeks Don't Get No Freeks". Is that right? I really liked that sound. I also liked the "Hyde's Got Nothing to Hide" in the final scenes. Truly a doper movie, but with many laughs and puns, sight gags, and slapstick. Madam Woo-Woo's place was reminiscent of some places I have visited myself. Ivy Venus has appeared in some other stuff that is truly amazing. She looks much different in the movie we're talking about, but her maturity didn't hurt her a bit.

The movie is excellent . Acting , cinematography , direction and music are spellbinding . It seems to me that it has been released in the form of a short film rather than a feature film . This was the first movie that I saw with an audience of my relatives and I found it quite difficult to judge the acting , story and cinematography from a distance. I was not disappointed in the movie . Plot :

It starts at night , a night of joy and pleasure , a night full of joy, when a man falls in love with his friend, a girl , who is very beautiful.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one ! I watched it when I got it to the theater in the US and I was shocked to see that it wasn't all over the screen like it was in the US . It seemed to move pretty much at its own pace and not have any sort of time lag , which makes me feel as though its a real good movie that you should not pass up. One thing is for sure this movie would have been way better if it was longer .

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? I doubt it!Blankfield was fairly popular at this time for playing the pill-popping doctor on Fridays. Thomerson has been funny in anything he does, from movies to series to stand-up comedy. If I ever find this movie on DVD I will definitely buy it. I recorded this movie off of HBO back in '82 and have pretty much worn out the tape. One of the funniest takes on the Jekyll & Hyde theme ever.Of course.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film. I have got to say that I think everyone was impressed with how good this movie was. Though, my roommate didn't care for it but he's not into horror movies anyway and just went to see if Paris Hilton can act. By the way, if you're worried about that, don't be. I'm not exactly one of her fans, but I must be honest and say she was pretty good and she has the best death scene. Overall, all the actor's were very good.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. This is a haunting tale of loneliness & missed connection in which the longing for intimacy conflicts with our fear of revealing too much about ourselves to another. The three leads (Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo) are all excellent and the dynamic between them is very surprising. After all the movies which devalue older women, it's wonderful to see Flavia (who is a law professor at a university in Rome) presented as beautiful & sensual as well as seductive & powerful.

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps the audience engaged from the start. The main characters have a great amount of screen time (the main couple is very cute) but you don't need to pay attention to anything, the actors are excellent and this movie is fun for both women and men. You will be able to see yourself on screen at the same time. It is a good comedy that is well-written and acted and the story is good and well-acted by the main actors.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave. I'm happy with that, as a big fan of horror, and I liked most of those new horror films. BOC is a one big pack of horror. Colorful, fast paced and original. I see this movie more like the opening of a new trilogy (much like Episode 1 and Aliens: Resurrection) since it comes up with a new twist. Instead of focusing on the little boy-killer doll relationship we have here a twisted movie about couples. We have the sweet young lovers in contrast with the killer crazy doll-sized lovers.

This is one of the best of the early "Star Trek" episodes, with Kirk and his crew venturing into the unknown to do battle with an enemy known only by name. Imagine their surprise when they find out that the dreaded Romulans are racial offshoots of the Vulcans! Young Mr. Stiles, well-played by Paul Comi, is one of the few truly unlikable characters in the "Star Trek" universe. His barely disguised hatred of Mr. Spock is eerily similar to the post-9/11 hatred and suspicion many Americans have of people of Arab or Middle Eastern origin.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time . It has an original plot and characters that are fresh and entertaining. This film is filled with characters who you are not familiar with at all and you feel comfortable with them all. The film has a great amount of comedy, a few romantic scenes and you are treated as a regular character in it. The movie is filled with action and excitement and you are not put in an awkward position in it’s plot. The action scenes here are great.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage's better films. He turns a fine performance as the title character. This is a romance set against the backdrop of a worn torn island. John Hurt's character gives his daughter, played beautifully by Penelope Cruz, some honest advice about love. This movie doesn't have the fault of being completely predictable. This movie also allows Cruz to turn in a performance as a strong woman who knows her own mind and heart. Once the film warms up beyond the opening sequence this film keep you focused on it.

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival. It was the opening night and was such a delightful movie. It was shot beautifully around India and I want to go there now. The main actor..Vijay was absolutely incredible. He was the highlight of the movie. Apparently he was also in the movie..Monsoon Wedding. He was the total star of the show. Benoit's character cracked me up...was very funny. And the girl (forget the name) was great too. They were all great!

If we could have `` Separate Tables , '' why not `` Separate Lies . `` This becomes somewhat involved, and it has to be explained how to do so. There are a number of ways, and it may seem tedious and complex, but the only thing that is necessary for it to work is to give yourself a few extra lines of code that have to do a lot of work:

.. code:: lua

   function Separate()
     -- This is what we have right now, but it seems a bit over complicated. -- I don't know of a good way to put this in.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film. I loved the music from the film. I thought it was great and so I wanted to see the film when I grew up but I was so young at that time to have that dream. As I got older I watched the film twice because I thought it had some great action scenes and it was great to see how amazing the film looked and how much the film was filmed. I watched the film on video.

As far as I know I've seen most of Lucio Fulci's films, with the exception of some later ones that are popping up on DVD now, and I would have to say this was his best "pre-zombie" offering. In fact it beats out his later movies hands-down. This is a tale of superstition and suspicion in a small Italian town out in the middle of nowhere, where young boys are dying mysteriously. It's no mystery how they died, I guess, it's more who's doing it. Is it a woman that the townspeople have always considered a witch?

* Could contain spoilers , read only after seeing last episode season 2 * Think about it . The guys have no idea how it ends... The Last One

Season 1 Episode 7

It started as a surprise, and then it became a foregone conclusion. It was that easy. I just had to have it. I knew what the ending would be. I knew what I'd be seeing. I knew who the good guys would end up. But as the episode came to an end, there was nothing left to say, no reason to explain why it could be so easy.

The movie is excellent. Acting, cinematography, direction and music are spellbinding. It seems to me that the reason so many give the movie a low score is because of the devotion they have to the original, 1937 version starring Ronald Coleman. That movie - for good reason! - engendered an unbelievable level of commitment. From talking with people who saw the original when it first came out, I believe the impact was something akin to the first "Starwars" movie in modern times. I have seen it. It was and is wonderful.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

It's Showtime! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro's careers. It's an entertaining movie and a guilty pleasure but not quite up to the actors' standards, especially not Robert's. Showtime is directed by Tom Dey and features some small roles from guys like William Shatner and Mos Def.Showtime is about two very different cops, Mitch Preston (DeNiro) and Trey Sellars (Murphy). One takes work seriously in a low profile, quiet manner while the other is more easy-going and wants to have more fun than felons in his back seat.

As a film buff , I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny , sarcastic comments about this movie prior to its release, which made me feel that I was in the minority of those who had actually liked the film. After watching the trailer , the first time, I found it a bit bland, with an overly simplified story that did nothing to add any excitement to the rest of it. This time around , it is a very different experience. This is a completely fresh, original story, and not a rehash of other, better works.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.Told in the style of a mystery movie, but with no mystery the movie is very well written. I like mystery movies and this movie is my first mystery movie. The story is very well made and interesting. The characters in the story are not in the movie for the sake of the story. In fact they are very important to the story and I like to have that in the movies. The plot in the movie is simple, but at times confusing, which can be confusing for a first-time audience.

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie . I caught it last night on TMC . It's about a woman that has cancer who becomes the love interest to a guy who is diagnosed with the same type of cancer. You can see all of the actors in this movie, and most of them were from the past. The director of this movie is a woman from the 90's so I have no idea why it made it back. It's a nice film . The story is a bit of a cliché, but that's what I would expect from a movie like that .

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to give myself a challenge to find more of them. I did that and I found a second pack of The Aristocats for sale. These are the second batch I've found so far. They are being offered for $7.99 on Amazon and I have had the opportunity to test them out. Here's what I think about these:

I liked the idea of The Aristocats on the first two editions of this book.

Some days ago, in Rome, a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a middle-age lady coming back home after an afternoon of shopping. A Romanian girl, who had seen everything, reported what happened.Therefore, it started a debate about the too much intense flow of immigrants from Romania, generalizing them as criminals, everyone, indiscriminately.I'm only 15, but I thought: what idea of affluence does Italy give to these poor people? How ever do they regard us as the Land of Plenty? Yesterday evening I finally saw NUOVOMONDO, and my question had an answer.

I saw this movie on it 's opening night , and enjoyed it . I probably would have enjoyed it more if I had been at the theater with my partner , but she didn't see it so that was not the reason for my enjoyment . I think they are looking to take the franchise back in time a little, I don't know what they will do, but it's interesting that it's done so early and with such a short story. If it was longer and with a good conclusion it would be worth the watch , but in this case it doesn't fit in.

First of all, around the time I wrote this comment, I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written about this game and was confused. This is a video game and not an actual movie. I mean, I myself would choose a good Deniro movie or playing a video game any day. But, dude, what are you talking about? Now that I have that out of the way, let's move on, shall we? The video game adaption of Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon is, as you may have guessed, based on the movie of the same name.

The Monkees , surprisingly , are a big favorite of mine . Yes , they might have been the original rock ‘n roll stars of the ’70s, but I’d never heard of ‘em until I heard about the new “Monkees” TV show. The first thing that came to mind when watching the new series is this : “Well, what did they do before the ‘Monkees?’” To me, “Monkees,” though not quite “rock ‘n roll,” was still the quintessential “rock” group from the ’40s, and the show certainly does their homage justice.

Being a middle aged mom myself , I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in and out of each other. But what happens when you fall in love with a guy who does not look as handsome as you do and is just as smart as you? I was disappointed to not see that in the story. It was refreshing to know that there is a way to fall for a guy with a different personality than your own, even if he’s a bit less than your equal in terms of intelligence.

Great movie. Post-apocalyptic films kick ass. This one is no exception. Kept up the pace and interest without a speck of dialogue (mainly through some good character development). The fight between Reno and the Hero was tight. I also liked the use of cave paintings and medieval-like weapons to show how primitive and savage mankind had become without their technology and guzzaline. The connection between the beginning and end was a little spacey, that is, I had a hard time understanding the distances between the hotel and the opening sequence.

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and, by the process, their own lives are not that uncommon. Also not uncommon are results that reflect lack of talent, a failure of introspection, an abundance of narcissism and, perhaps, an unsubtle quest for publicly-splashed revenge for countless past hurts, real and fantasized. What is unusual is a brilliant, fair and engrossing portrait of a fascinating parent and "My Architect: A Son's Journey" is that rare achievement.Louis Kahn emigrated to this country as a child, his face irreparably and brutally scarred by an accident.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but manages not to let the film turn into schmalz.This is a fantastic film, its funny with sad bits and it makes you look at things differently. Tell everyone you know to go see it now- FANTASTIC!The acting is excellent, and Dublin plays a starring role. This film will change the way you view people with disabilities and also give you a very entertaining night out in the cinema. I can't wait til it comes out on DVD.

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could possibly want from a holiday movie. It's well made, has great special effects (the most impressive thing about it), a really funny script, and has a really touching story. The actors are really nice, the special effects are pretty impressive, the acting is all great, and the plot is just great. My only complaint is that it takes quite a while to get to the end and I wish they would have at least slowed it down a bit more.

I do n't usually comment on films since I am in the movie distribution business , but I have to say this is a great film. I've never seen anything like it and if I was able to, I'd definitely buy it in a minute. I've already bought all the extras I could get my hands on which includes a DVD, book and an audio. If you want to buy the DVD, be forewarned that it only has 2 hours of extra footage so you may have a long wait. You'll be waiting a while for that.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . If I was asked , I couldn't say anything else. I was so moved by his performance . I was amazed at how he portrayed a human being . His character was so realistic . I can say , he didn't portray him as some kind of monster but as someone living a normal life . I don't think I am exaggerating by saying it was the most memorable performance I have ever witnessed . There are people who say this is only a role but I say it is true .

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply . I 've been looking for it for a bit and I have found it so far. I have found some other pictures in this forum that are not so good. I was hoping to find some decent quality pictures to replace them, but now I think I have to look on other forums for these pictures. I would love to find a really good copy of the same picture that I found for free on the net. Please help! I have seen a few of these for sale on the Internet and some other websites.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre , but I think this one is done quite well. Its a shame they don’t have an anime director in charge, because the anime itself is excellent and well done! I really liked this show the first time I watched it but now that I have watched it multiple times I am a fan of it. I would also like to recommend the other two shows by the same name which I have not watched, but I will check those out.

Lucio Fulci, later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie, was years earlier a master of the Italian giallo (in the company of Argento and Bava) with films like A Lizard In A Woman's Skin and his masterpiece, Don't Torture A Duckling. This film has all the elements of the Italian mystery/thriller genre known as the giallo, but really pulls the viewers in by having each key character with a skeleton in his/her own closet. This keeps you doing as much detective work as the detectives in the film itself. Who is killing the young boys in town?

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel , I have to say that I was shocked by the quality. It was not only well written, but they were actually giving a real plot to every episode. If you have been watching this series long enough , you will have seen it many times. The plot is actually well thought out. There were so many mysteries to follow in the series. The action was just as expected . I was not at all happy with the ending of all the episodes I watched.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job . He apparently knows where the money is and where you will find it. He does his part of the act of being a pimp ,and he plays it well. The action is a little slow, but this is a fun strip game that gets better and better as the comic progresses. The comic is fast paced and always keeps up with the story line. I enjoyed this comic and am sure you will as well. Just to add to the comic, this is a fun game.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance, a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - and beautiful scenery. Nicholas Cage never fails us, and here again does a great job. And so do the other principle characters. One key charater, the physician/father played by John Hurd, delivers (to his daughter) one of the best definitions of love I've ever heard. Some of the events are a bit too coincidental to be real, but I excused that, knowing that this is partly fairy tale and fantacy. My wife and I really liked the film.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre. Set in rural Italy, there is a serial killer of children at large. Add to the mix an array of characters familiar to fans of giallo cinema  a madwoman, a newspaper reporter, ineffectual police, a sexy siren, a priest, a mute girl, a mentally-retarded loner etc. This is one of the best Italian thrillers of the early 70's.Unusually for a giallo, the victims in this case are young boys, which makes a change from the more typical women in peril angle.

"A Slight Case of Murder" is an excellent TV movie, which is defiantly worth the price of a rental. William H. Macy is great as a movie critic who accidentally kills his mistress, and then has to try to conceal the crime. Although that may sound dark, the film is actually quite light hearted and funny, with many memorable lines ("Acting is harder than I thought- you ever see BODY HEAT? I think I owe Bill Hurt an apology" and my personal favourite "For next week answer these two questions about film noir, What do these people do during the day?

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few. The wise can see the wisdom contained in what most call folly.This music may well regain popularity as world consciousness rises. It is about a land "far away from it all" where "living things have room to grow." Its people are "living and growing together" mentally and spiritually faster than in biological age.The lyrics help us recognize the relativity of this "world that is spinning around" and to "look inside yourself; that is where the Truth always lies."

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

probably the best horror movie in 5 years .. there 's been lame remakes , attempts to make you scared by making you afraid to see the movie for the first time ... well this is the horror movie for everyone with a strong stomach who wants to be terrified and scared in this one movie .. and that 's pretty much everyone ! The film 's really funny and it has the perfect amount of scare and fear in every part of this movie , the story is very well done , it has suspense in it and it has awesome effects ...

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918. In fact, it is now more available with two other medium sized silent Chaplin features (A DOG'S LIFE, and THE PILGRIM) that Chaplin re-released in the 1950s. In it's day SHOULDER ARMS was a big hit because of it's humor in uniform approach. It still is very funny (Chaplin in disguise as a tree, spying on the Germans, is so ridiculous it's hysterical), but it suffers from being set in it's own age.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO, regardless of the age of the OAV. The plot itself makes sense, but the characters don't.This might sound picky, but considering that the city of Olympus is almost exclusively populated by living machines, would YOU feel comfortable there as a human? Would any machine ever emulate human arrogance, short-sightedness and greed quite so effectively? I doubt it. There are some pointers towards this in the movie, but only when the team can be bothered to put them in, by and large the 'bioroids' (or whatever they are) are interchangeable with human characters.

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime , Lifetime Movie Network’s HD network, and it was awesome . I had never seen a Lifetime show before, it was so cool, it was so realistic , but it also had a lot of humor in it , and I did laugh a lot as a kid because of The Morrison Murders . The movie was so well made , it was like a real movie that was made , and it was very well directed , and it was really good .

Dr. Paul Flanner ( Richard Gere ) , a successful surgeon , has his wife leave him , his son get married , his house is on fire , he loses everything . , , , you never know what is going on . , , . ,

Dr. Paul , a surgeon and father , is in a terrible accident . , ,

Paul is in a bad car accident . , ,

Paul has a concussion and has to go to the Emergency Room for further tests . , , ,

Paul is in the ER for a brain injury .

Great show ! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps . Contestants range in ages from newborn to old folks . We get a chance to see families with kids that have never been outside of TV for a real live experience. We get to see what kind of challenges they have to work with each other in order to succeed . How hard they have to work and how far they are willing to go to make it through . What I Loved : This show was great and I'm really excited about it. I enjoyed seeing this family live their lives .

I 've never seen the original `` House Of Wax '' so I really did n't know what to expect. The first thing I noticed when looking at the album cover is that it's very similar to the original album, only in this album, there are some more photos. From the album cover to the first song, the songs are pretty much exactly the same as the original. The only difference is that this album has less photos. If you listen to the original, the main difference is that the first two songs are very similar.

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007. I saw this film three years ago at the Vancouver International film Festival and have been waiting for it's release ever since so I could send everyone I know to see it. It's like taking a trip to India....colorful, magical, thought provoking. Aside from one rather strange Hollywood style auto rickshaw chase scene this movie is very realistic. This is not a Bollywood style song and dance movie but it does have drama and romance and humor.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency . Putney Swope is on the board for the second year and the meeting is very important. He wants to do it right. Putney Swope is a good board member. It's important to the company that they hire a good man at a good place to be. He does the job. The company is in trouble because Putney Swope does not know the people on the board; that puts them at a huge disadvantage. In the end the board hires Putney Swope. It's a great movie because it has a great message.

Duchess and her three kittens are enjoying the high life with their devoted human mistress until the wicked butler Edgar arrives to whisk her to the dungeon. After learning that she is a traitor who is plotting to assassinate her uncle, she is forced to use her wiles to escape. The story of this beautiful woman who is a spy with a strong sense of duty, who fights to live a life that is not as she thinks it is, and who does what she believes in is a fascinating tale of love, friendship, family, and intrigue.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery's best performances in a movie, and I have seen most of her movies.I saw this for the first time on television when I was around fourteen, and I was so scared.I watch this movie every now and then, and I still enjoy it very much.I know that these days that this movie would probably not scare people too much.That just goes to show that the public movie and television audience has seen too much graphic violence in the last thirty years or so.I love movies that do not show the graphic details, you let your imagination do the work for you.

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this one . it begins with this line:

That's the only reason I'm not dead . And that , you will agree , is the point . the film , as with every other of the series , follows a series of events which occur to the protagonist of this one . at the beginning , we are introduced to the character by seeing his name which in this case is not the name of the character , but of the hero .

I've commented once on this Chucky great, but I had to do it again to say some things about the film, when I first saw it in a great balcony in a great theater. The film was a lot of fun in the theater and my first Chucky film ever in a theater, and that was a special moment for me, because I cherish Chucky. The other horror villains are referenced with GREAT COOLNESS!!! And the gore was shockingly great! The scene where the gay kid gets nailed by the truck was amazingly cheerful!

This new installment to the Child 's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as the classic "It was a bear's birthday party" and "You got a bad attitude." The cast is still young and cute, so they're having a blast together. I love this book, I really really do and I love how the characters are so likable and I am so glad to finally get another book. Wednesday, November 16, 2014

I've had this book on my TBR for quite some time now, but I finally decided to go ahead and get it today.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar! The film took a while to pick up from the start, at least for me seeing as I expected this was a run-along America Pie flick. But it was slightly different-- a fun-loving slacker who finishes high school and makes his OWN college, running it accordingly. As you can expect, there's a lot of parties and hot girls in bikinis but this film tried harder than your average teen flick. Bartleby Gaines (Justin Long) encourages his students / peers to learn through freedom of expression and ultimately 'shove it to the system.'

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I 've seen in a while . It 's an emotional roller-coaster ride with a lot of suspense and a great soundtrack . I 've had the privilege of seeing this film at least six times. It never gets old . I recommend this movie highly to every lover of suspense . This movie is a must see . . . It 's not only an emotional roller coaster ride that never loses it's edge , it 's a great suspense thriller . An interesting story and a great story that you should see with your own eyes.
